Reviews.Title: “Wonderful neighborhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenturtle2
Reviews.Content: The Five Hotel is a wonderful hotel located in the Latin Quarter. The neighborhood is quiet and mostly residential. It is about 10 mins walk to the nearest metro station (Les Gobelins), and about a 20 mins walk to Notre Dame. The hotel staff speaks good English, and are very friendly and helpful. The rooms themselves are small, as the other reviews have said, but I thought it was quite cozy. The trendy decor was fun; I loved the LED lights in the bed frame and shower. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice design, I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Melinda B
Reviews.Content: I love such hotels. Very nice design. It makes you feel different but comfortable. I will definitely come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, romantic, great bedding; OK location.”
Reviews.Author: Schrodingers_Cat
Reviews.Content: The core product a hotel offers is, after all, the bed, and The Five gets it right: Great mattress; high quality sheets freshly pressed, nice pillows. The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood but not smack-dab central; less than 10 minutes walk in either direction to the metro, bus line (including the night buses if you're out late) stops pretty much across the street from the hotel, so you can get anywhere you want pretty easily. It's near the Rue Mouffetard. The people working there were friendly, but I did not call on them for any services so I can't speak to how helpful they are. Clerk at check in spoke excellent English; she lived in NYC for a while; I spoke mostly French with the others so I can't say about their English. I did not take any meals at the hotel (they offer a breakfast), so I can't judge that. Our room was the "scintillating Romance" or some similar name. It was, as with other Parisien hotels, very small. But the surfaces and decorations were stylish and attractive; top quality bathroom fixtures and well thought-out lighting made the room very attractive. We were located in the back on the 4th floor; very quiet with good daylight. The overall effect was polished and a little glamorous. Storage space was pretty limited (pick up any modern design magazine, look at pictures of beautiful, zen-like rooms, and realize that the cost of all that clean minimalist design is that there's no place to put your stuff. An extra shelf in the batthroom, maybe a drawer or two under the writing desk, would be nice. They do take the romance thing a little bit far: fragrance in the room, cloth rose petals strewn on the bed, etc. Either you'll love that or you'll find it over the top. On the whole, my wife and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Boutique Hotel In The Latin Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Sunculpah
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Hotels.com and found a fantastic deal. Our room was the one called 'The Scintillating Canopy' room and although it was small is was the best stay we've had in a hotel. Our room was on the 6th floor and had a charming little balcony overlooking the Parisienne rooftops. Each of the rooms in the hotel has a "scent" and we picked the vanilla & honey one. It smelled heavenly. The bathroom was small as well but well appointed with a LED shower and L'occitane bath products. The best thing though was the service. The staff went above & beyond what was expected. Super helpful and extremely friendly, they gave us lots of suggestions and were always ready with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: sipari_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Five Hotel for seven nights in March. As the other reviews state the staff are quite friendly and speak good english. The rooms are small as I expected which was fine but I feel the bathroom could have been more functional. There should be shelving above the sink to place toiletries on, as there is virtually no place to put things. I ended up placing a towel over top of the sink to put my makeup on when getting ready in the morning. There is easy access to the Les Goblins subway station and a Starbucks close by to grab a morning coffee before starting your day.

Reviews.Title: “New concept in the city of romance”
Reviews.Author: merge68
Reviews.Content: The days are over where we had to rummage all known resources to find a decent hotel in Paris. Now a variety of great options exist, some cheap some more extravagant! The Five Hotel was a surprise for me (as arranged by my Wife) and I was not expecting much as I had no clue. Cutting the chase: Initiation: No seriously we were introduced to the concept of the room we had ( the suit). Tanya made it clear that the room was specifically designed to re-live or re-enact your relationship. The interior of the hotel (lobby etc) is a bit "dark-ishly" designed. We had great weather outside but the hotel entree of the hotel was curtained off from natural light. The Room: the room we had (the suit) was great and with all amenities one would expect to have a great night in: a kitchenette with nespresso machine, ipod/music console, tv, sat, ambiance enhancing lighting etc. Even...a camera for in-room (read bedroom) adventure...for those who seek more than just a hand-in-hand stroll on the bridges and want to indulge further sensory pleasures. It even had a small backyard where we had a candlelit chat+drinks. Our suit was outside the main building on the street level. Sometimes commotion (not much) may alert you (cars driving by, people walking etc.). But in general it was all rather quiet and cozy. The food: we had only breakfast and it was great. good cheese, nice bread, butter, coffee and tea. I like the quality of the items used. Our breakfast was room-served but you can have it by the lobby. Although it is greatly and purposefully designed, I found it too gloomy after a long night. The location: It is in the Quartier Latin, with a variety of options to hang out in the area. you can find sweet little reastaurants, groceries and small shops and a number of cafes which are great to puff a cigarette with a coffe of tea. we even came across a stall market where we bought fresh fruit. It takes approx. 10 mins to walk to the Port-Royal RER station (where you can take the train to CDG airport. It took us about 40 mins to walk to coolly to St.Germain The staff: They were all great and very helpful. They were all there when we needed something. Always positive and smiling. All in all it was worht the price. we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, kind, elegant”
Reviews.Author: j0yeaux
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little out of my price range but I wanted a nice place to stay for my first night in Paris. Also, I booked at the last minute so I think it was a bit more expensive because of that. The staff was very sweet and spoke english, beautifully. The room was very clean, and sunny, the bed was WONDERFUL, and the room was very quiet. The soap smelled amazing. The street was quiet and close (just a short walk) to the metro station. Breakfast was delicious- many things to choose from. My one draw back about this hotel was that my room was not as interesting as I had hoped. All the really nifty rooms must be reserved for couples. But, the room I had was perfect for me and I slept really well. I really enjoyed my stay a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: ReaperX
Reviews.Content: Well maintained and nicely decorated. Totally bring out the holiday mood in you. Close to both Metro and RER stations. The interior of the hotel is nicely decorated and the color combination are vibrant. Decors are unique and modern, totally different environment as compared to a normal hotel. Rooms might be smaller, but it's about the same in most hotel in Paris. Well, who will be staying in the room anyway. Nevertheless, the rooms are complete with safe deposit box, hair dryer, water heater (with LED shower head), TV (mostly in French, but certain shows are in English) and everything you need to put on a comfortable night, before going for sight seeing/shopping the next day. :) The hotel is about 5-10 minutes walk from both Metro Line 7 (Les Goblins) and RER B (Port Royal). A taxi ride from CDG Airport to the hotel might cost you about Eu70-80, whereas by using the RER B, it's only about Eu10 per person.

Reviews.Title: “The room has a nice smell and very nice designed”
Reviews.Author: Dorothyzhang
Reviews.Content: At first I think the room and toilet is small. But when I use them, the room, the toilet, the desk, all are sufficient! And I love the design in the room and the "love capsule" The smell in the room is also excellent. It is so nice to stay here. Also the location is excellent. I would return definitely and recomment! Room are very clean. The towers are very nice as well. Bed is comfortable. All have an excellent standard!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Jennus
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in Summer 2011 and it's a lovely hotel, perhaps a little pricey but it is Paris after all, and the rooms are lovely, very clean and the staff are very friendly. It was a little difficult to find on foot but I'm sure my map skills probably aren't the best. Loads of nice restaurants close to the hotel and there's a cracking little bar opposite the entrance selling cheap drinks (3 euro a beer/wine/cider, extremely cheap in Paris). Only slight negative is the size of the room, although I suppose that is similar in a lot of continental hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: flowersui
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny (acess to the bed on one side only in my room) but the fun decor makes up for it and you have everything you could possibly need in a small space. The staff were extremely friendly and helped with printing, ordering taxis etc. The breakfast was pretty good although i would have liked a real coffee (expresso machine with capsules available), but the tea selection was good. The room was quiet despite a main street nearby Would definately recommend if you're looking for something different but at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, not close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: mturk043
Reviews.Content: This hotel's rooms are superb. They are well decorated, with perfect lighting for all activities. Even the small rooms have enough space to be comfortable, and to get some light work (postcard writing) done. The staff are very helpful. On the other hand, the hotel is at least a ten minute walk from the closest Metro or RER stations. And then you still have to get to where you want to go. The hotel does not seem particularly close to any major tourist sites. My advice would be to stay here to take advantage of the price and comfort/quality, but make sure you budget for a Metro pass.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: 123iloveholidays123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel as our first trip away together and it was, without a doubt the best possible hotel that we could have chosen! The location was great, surrounded by lovely cafes and restaurants and it was only a short metro ride away from the main attractions so it was very easy to get everywhere.The staff were all very kind and made lots of helpful suggestions about good restaurants near-by. We booked this hotel on lastminute.com and we booked a 'romantic room' so we were unsure of which room type we would have after looking on the official Five Hotel website and assumed it would just be a standard one but when we arrived and checked in it was better than we could have imagined. The room was a perfect size for us and the bed was extremely comfortable surrounded by hanging drapes and there were even had fairy lights built into the walls around the bed and in the shower! We were like little kids again getting very over excited! We had a perfect trip and i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic trip away in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a long weekend in Paris and stayed at the Five Hotel. We had a fantastic stay at the hotel and highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to experience the real Paris. It is very well located close to Rue Mouffetard which was great for restaurants (all types of food available) and boutiques. Port Royal station is located just a few minutes walk away for easy access to CDG or Gare du Nord should you be arriving by plane or train. The Metro is also minutes walk away for direct access to tourist attractions such as the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were spotless and very well equipped. All are very unique, adding to the appeal of the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel as we were just a stones throw from town and its restaurants, however the staff were excellent and recommended some great places to go to. We would definitely stay here again! Mike & Meg

Reviews.Title: “Good & Different”
Reviews.Author: AksSun
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded and got another surprise (Champagne) when we checked in. Must say that all the people there are very courteous and were extremely helpful in providing the best services possible. I wish that the rooms were bigger in size (maybe it is me, as I am used to bigger rooms) and the price low .. !! I will recommend this hotel to my friends and family .. !!

Reviews.Title: “Loud construction in lobby, AC not working in room, small rooms, lousy service. Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: jessenewland
Reviews.Content: Paid twice as much as the Marriott for a 'romantic night' that was a wash before it even started. It's a cool December night in Paris, but yet somehow sweltering in the room and our AC doesn't work at all - the thermostat in the room seems to be a dummy. Called the desk before dinner, they asked what temp I wanted it. Same temp when I got back 4 hours later and no air blowing. There was also loud construction happening in the lobby that we could hear in the room at checkin. I've written this review while waiting for the staff to bring the bottle of champagne included in our package to our room, and was going to give them the benefit of the doubt and revise things if they could get the AC working when the one staff member on site showed up with the champagne, but now my wife is asleep and I'm pretty sure the champagne isn't coming. I'd stay away if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Small but modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Manthos
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at the Five despite the reviews describing the rooms as smaller than small. I have been in smaller rooms in Paris. I booked my room directly on the hotel web site for 98 euros/night (plus 10 euros for the french breakfast). I find the rate a reasonable value for money, by Parisian standards. What I liked: Friendly and knowledgeable reception girl who also recommended a very good french restaurant across the street on the left called the Marguery). Very clean and modern room, enough for a short stay of one person. Nice toiletries in the small but stylish bathroom. BBC world, CNN and CNBC on TV along with many french and international channels. Sadaharu AOKI, the famous french-japanese pastry shop round the corner. What they could do better: Too much red in the public spaces and too little daylight. Why? Rather cold in the room, I would like a heavier duvet. I would stay again if given a similar rate. I'd like to also test the "sister establishment" nearby called The Seven hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very over priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: judi c
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and the room was the smallest ever even by Paris standards. For the really expensive prices that this place charges it is ridiculously over priced. The neighborhood is also not very good either and far from sights. I purposely booked in this area thinking it was a part of Paris I had not seen but aside from a few new parks I found myself having to spend a lot of time travelling. Having stayed at a few different places in Paris (all of them other boutique hotels) I can say that this was by far the worse and even more expensive than others that were much better. The balcony was full of dirty cigarette butts all over too and not really fun for non smokers to hang out in. Also the bed was like almost on the ground barely a foot over with a very cheap mattress and bed. This is officially the worst bed that I have stayed in at any hotel. I am so surprised there are so many good reviews on this place. Thought I'd contribute to give a more fair account.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Hungryforcheese
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and really enjoyed the hotel. Very friendly staff and very nice atmosphere. Bathrooms are small, especially shower, but no real issues if your are mobile. Located in a nice, central area. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: MagicalRhyme
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine - a small boutique hotel with friendly staff and free internet (that is surprisingly important to me and, even more surprisingly, still rare). The front staff was also very friendly. I found the rooms to be a little too small. I was not a big fan of the interior design but that is a question of personal taste. I thought the area was a little bit too quite for my tastes but it is a short walk to the metro (RER station). You can also walk to la Sorbonne, the Panthéon, Musée du moyen âge, Ile de la Cité and Notre Dame. There are also some charming and very reasonably priced cafés in the vicinity. All in all, it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “charming staff !”
Reviews.Author: blackmememe
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this Hotel for one night after a trip to the South of France. The staff could not have been more helpfull and friendly. The room yes small but lovely and very clean. Another huge positive was how quiet it was through the night, we had not had much sleep due to noise and not very comfortable beds on our trip but the Five was heaven ! the best sleep in 2 weeks. The Breakfast was help yourself and very good not cooked but lots to choose from. The area within 2 minutes walk is very busy if you like that sort of thing but there are good restaurants very near. We spend Christmas in Paris and will certainly spend it at the 5.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: pedrinhoprado
Reviews.Content: It's an old fashion type of service, where you find yourself as a VIP even before you arrive. As for it's concept of design it's just a nice mixture, being in an ancient fantastic city as Paris and relaxing in a very confortable modern hotel. The customizing of the serveurs attempts both newlyweds or business quick trips. I higly recommend mostly because of this details, that makes you very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in a nice quiet part of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Matt C
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel I always try to stay in boutique hotels and finding one in Paris for a decent price proved to be tricky until I stumbled upon a review for 'Five'. The people at the reception were super helpful, the hotel itself is pretty cool (although the decor is quite bold) and everything was extra clean. The location is not as central as some locations, but a 5-10 minute metro to the central stations and it is actually in a nice neighbourhood that offers a refreshing change from the super touristy areas where most of the hotels are situated. If you are looking for something a bit different and want good value then this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small. Staff are great. Location is reasonable and... Rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: RuralRides
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small is the common theme in most reviews of the Five and, well, they are. Not just small in the 'Oh I do not mind squeezing up a bit' or 'What do people expect, the Albert Hall?' sort of way, but the 'Japanese capsule hotel' or 'How many students can you fit in a Mini?' sort of way! Every time I had a shower (clean and reasonably powerful) I bumped my elbow or my head or my toe and every time my wife and I wanted to move around the room we had to do it in an agreed sequence just to be able to get past one another! Moving on from the smallness of the rooms, the saving grace of the hotel for us was the staff. We stayed through Christmas and so really wanted our visit to be special and - despite the snow storms and permanent sub-zero temperatures - it was and the staff played a large part in that; they are very knowledgeable about public transport and restaurants and attractions and although they, like the hotel, are a bit trendy it is not in an annoying way. The decor is supposed to be super-modern and produced by cutting edge designers and it was fine as far as it goes; it does take your mind off how small the rooms are, I suppose (have I mentioned that already?). The location was off the beaten track enough to be different but still close enough to the main sites for us. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower one day, although everyone thought we were mad. They have a sister hotel, the Seven, just round the corner; we might try that the next time, because the rooms at the Five are quite small (oh, sorry, I already said that).

Reviews.Title: “Would look for a better deal”
Reviews.Author: Caspartje
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel; based on TripAdvisor reviews, but was highly disappointed. The room itself was okay, but small. I know that hotels in Paris have small rooms, but I have been in larger hotel rooms in Paris at a cheaper rate (with larger beds!). Most important, though, is that its location is about as unconvenient as it can get. The nearest two Metro stations are 20-30 minute walks away!! Buffet breakfast room is very small, if you show up here with a group (as we did), chances are high you cannot get a table. Furthermore, on one of the days I stayed here I arrived back in the hotel after dinner, and my room was not made up. The staff apologized and offered a free breakfast (maid had already gone home). I did not make a big deal out of it, but I did not expect this from a hotel at this price. In all, I found the hotel overpriced and poorly located. It's only trendy in the lobby, the rooms themselvers are not. A good thing is that they offered free WiFi. I would never stay here again but look for a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHope
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my son, while he was traveling throughout Europe. Hotel staff were wonderful to communicate with and my son reported all positive remarks. I can't wait for my next trip to Paris so I can enjoy this gem myself.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, tucked away, and trendy...”
Reviews.Author: robbowantsadonna
Reviews.Content: My preface begins: In a hotel, my wife and I look for cleanliness and location above anything else. In this respect, The Five Hotel is aces. Sure, the room is small, but at this price point, show me a large room, and I’ll show you a ham sandwich. Every other hotel we’ve stayed at in Paris (well, two, Grand Hommes and de la Sorbonne) had the same size room for the same price. Get over it, the rooms are small in this city...and really...you are in Paris, GET OUT OF THE ROOM...there is so much to see and do. The location was great as it was in a quiet part of town off the tourist track just enough to be considered “off the tourist track”. Five minutes walk in either direction and you were back in the thick of things. Close to Rue Mouffetard, which is a buzzing street with small shops and delicious things to eat. Metro stop Les Gobliens within a five minute walk as well. A good café/pub across the street with an affordable happy hour of 3.50 Euro pints...which was a welcome change from the 8 euro pints almost everywhere else a tourist is going to exist. Staff was amazing, and ever present at the front desk, and welcomed us with a friendly greeting upon each entrance and did their best to lend a hand when asked. The entire hotel, including our room, was clean and super modern. The Five Hotel is highly recommended for those unfussy types looking for a cozy place to stay, while at the same time getting the “boutique” experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again- if it were 50 (ok,75...) Euros cheaper.”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasedSoul
Reviews.Content: Don't have much more to say. It's very funky, with hip staff, and about 3-4 minutes (unique underpass- hard to see on googlemaps) from the wonderfully Parisian and never-ending mouffetard lane. The rooms are tiny indeed, but who's in Paris to be nestled in a room? --- Love is meant to be displayed while strolling along les rues de Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Small, but nice rooms, poor location, mixed service from staff”
Reviews.Author: freshlegs5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Five Hotel for the weekend of the 7th and 8th of May. The first issue we had was finding the place, the taxi driver had never heard of the street and this was the case for the rest of the weekend - even to the extent of being dumped about a mile from the hotel on Saturday night with the taxi driver saying that he had got us to the hotel!!!! Check in was 4pm which we felt was quite late, but we were able to freshen up in the toilets, not ideal but OK. Got some good advice from the reception in terms of how to get around town etc - where was the nearest metro. When we finally got to the room, I was surprised by the size of the room. Not much space other than the bed, girls there is no dressing table to do your make up on as my wife discovered and the bathroom was small but clean. The room was decorated in a nice way but the size just put us off slightly. The bad bit about the service was when I asked for an iron and ironing board ont he first night, they bought an iron but said they did not know where the ironing board was. I had to make do using a towel on a table - which I do not mind, but when I am paying what this hotel costs I expect to get at least that. They said that they would get me an ironing board for the next night, but when I rung down they just bought up another iron and my request for the board was met with a shrug of shoulders. Annoyed me a lot really. There was also some work being done in the reception area during our stay - not really disruptive but again when paying the money I just expected a bit better. The general location is quite good near the Pantheon, but hardly what I would call in the heart of the latin quarter. To sum up I would say that yes it is small but knowing Paris I reckon that is par for the course. I would say get a hotel a bit more in the heart of the Latin Quarter if you want to go to this area.

Reviews.Title: “A small hidden gem in paris”
Reviews.Author: awesleyj
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over the world. This hotel is unique. The rooms are small, but very well appointed. I loved the lighting, and decor....great! The best thing about this funky, frisky spot is the staff. They are simply the nicest, most helpful, in Paris....I felt like I was staying with my best friends... I feel like I should not reccommend it, so I can keep it to myself, but The Five Hotel will make your stay in Paris better.....absolutely....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GoGoPiaggio
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at The Five Hotel for two nights in March and could not have been more pleased with our choice. The value for money at the hotel was terrific and the location superb. Additionally, the staff were really helpful and kind and the rooms (while small) were modern, clean, and charming. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Smart little hotel, with the emphasis on little!”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen by my girlfriend as a surprise present for me (i.e. a trip to Paris). As neither of us had been to the city before she looked around Trip Advisor reviews and asked her friends for recommendations and The Five Hotel came out very favourably. The hotel isn’t particularly centrally located, with it being in the 13th Arrondissement, but it is very close to the 5th, however, Paris isn’t *that* big of a city, so being bang central isn’t much of a problem. Check –in is at 4pm, which to me does seem a little late. We arrived at 12:30pm so we were able to ditch our bags and go out and do the ‘tourist’ things. When we did finally get back and were able to get into our room, I was a little disappointed. Firstly the rooms are *very* small, BUT having looked at other hotel reviews, this is a common complaint about Parisian hotels especially by our American cousins; it was fine. More perturbing to me was the lack of a mini-bar; not that I am a user of such things (over-priced EVERYWHERE you go, however they are ideal to put your own store bought drinks/food in there), but with The Five only being a three star it wasn’t expected. Thankfully, as the room had a large windowsill we were able to put our wine/beer/water out there to chill. At the end of the first day (up at 5am, Eurostar, Effiel Tower and Père Lachaise) we were knackered and asked the lovely receptionist Paulina (Polina?) for a recommendation for somewhere to eat. She made us a reservation at Tor Bellon (see separate review) and we were most impressed! We didn’t have breakfast so can’t rate that, but overall this is a quite good little hotel. There are only 25 rooms (I think) and they are all small, but as I ALWAYS say you don’t go on holiday to spend time in a hotel room. That said, I do think they could have a couple of English speaking channels on their TVs (CNN or BBC please, none of this Sky nonsense!) I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, the staff are extremely lovely and the bed was extremely comfy. What more can you ask?!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: katieguerrini
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with beautiful rooms. Bathrooms modern, very clean too. Cannot fault the reception staff they were so helpful. Tube needed to get to the centre however which is a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: gvid200
Reviews.Content: The staff and location are fantastic and makes the stay worth it, the rooms ARE small-

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: colin414
Reviews.Content: Concierges are helpful and a definite plus. Close to RER and buses. As in many Paris conversions, the rooms are tiny and the sound insulation is sadly lacking. Perhaps the promised champagne might have cheered us up if it had arrived. Hard to turn round in the bathroom, but the plumbing worked well. The smell of artificial potpourri was too strong for us.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: Activetravell3r
Reviews.Content: This design hotel is in a central position, and with two metro stations at short distance. Located in a side street of Latin barrio, it is a quite place, and no street noise at all. Great assistance from the staff, very kind, available to help, and provide assistance. Despite standard room and bathroom are tiny, as usual in most hotels in Paris, the envirorment is very appealing due to its colorful design. A very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chip_cosby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first few days of our Honeymoon staying at The Five. We loved every second of it. The decor is amazing, the rooms are clean and the service is impeccable. The Five is also in a hip part of town which was the cherry on top for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cosy and modern hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JSC123
Reviews.Content: Not quite as funky as it looks online but they've tried to give this the boutique hotel experience. Rooms are comfortable clean and, although small, fine for a few days. We had a room at the front which gave a view out onto the quiet street. Staff friendly and helpful and speak good English. We never tried the breakfast as there are so many good options nearby. Location is good rather than great - a 10 minute walk to Jardin de Luxembourg, 20 to St Germain.

Reviews.Title: “A small funky hotel in the 5th”
Reviews.Author: Vinifico
Reviews.Content: We used this as our base in Paris for 3 nights and were pretty happy with our stay. The one thing I'd note is that our "Scintillating" room was VERY small. By small, I mean the entire room was about the size of an average guest bedroom - no extra room for bags or even a chair. The bathroom was also tiny with a shower that had me struggling to turn around. Having said all that, I'd also like to note that for the price (in Paris) it was a great deal and I'd maybe stay there again. The staff was great (and spoke very good English - and were very polite about our struggles to speak French) and the location was pretty handy. The funky decorating and small LED lights were fun and the bed was very comfortable. Our room was also extremely quiet and looked out on a small courtyard. My one real complaint was that our request for an iron yielded an iron, but the ironing board was never delivered.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of affordable Paris chic...”
Reviews.Author: dinkypaws
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Aug 2010 to explore all of Paris. The reception area is lovely, really small but cosy with all the lighting and quiet music. The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. We arrived early and they took our luggage until our room was ready. The rooms are small, but they are gorgeous. They have lots of wee lights everywhere, makes it feel romantic. The bed is comfortable too which is always a bonus. Loved the shower, it constantly changed colour when you were in it. Cannot comment on the breakfast as we tended to eat out. Its only a 10 min walk to the Metro Les Gobelins down the hill which is really handy (but you can only buy tickets from the entry to the Metro at the left hand side of the road, not the right). There are lots of French restaurants near the hotel. We liked EPSILON just a few minutes up the hill from the Metro, they have various set menus ranging from 13euros for a 3course to 24euros for a 3 course. For the 24euros I had scallops to start, rack of lamb, potato and veg for main, a citron tart for dessert. All lovely food and excellent service. Would definitely recommend this hotel to young couples wanting to explore Paris. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but suite with hottub is on ground floor”
Reviews.Author: vermeerdublin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Five Hotel from 1-3 Sep 2010. We had chosen the suite with hottub as a treat. The rooms with personalsied lighting are nice, albeit small. The staff very very helpful. My only grumble, is that the hot tub and suite are on the ground floor and not as I had assumed on a top floor or a balcony. That said is youre looking for a nice hotel fort a special time away do consider the Five! Oh and by the way we ordered a bottle of champagne to our room for arrival, it only cost €45!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: madanu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed three nights at the Five Hotel as part of our honeymoon trip. The service was top-notch. The staff was very helpful and cheerful. I love the style of the rooms - just like the photos on their site. The little lights, aromatherapy, and quality toiletries are just small things, but really make an impression. Our room was small, as expected based on the reviews, but this is typical of Paris in my experience. We didn’t have any problem with the size of the room, and we had a lot of luggage. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, because we stumbled upon a fabulous breakfast spot called La Salle à Manger on Rue Mouffetard. We looked forward to the great meals there each morning. The Five Hotel is not far from the metro, which was our primary mode of transportation. All in all, the highlight of this hotel was the cool decor and the super nice people working there. I would definitely return and would love to try some of their other hotels. Thanks for a lovely visit, Five Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, romantic, good value, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: reganc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed in the Five hotel while traveling through France. We saw on the website that there was a great deal on the Canopy room for 149 euros a night, we managed to get it for 129euros for the first night and 149euros for the second. The room concepts are cool and different and when you walk into the hotel you just get a smile on your face because its not like anything you have seen before. The hotel is a small boutique hotel and it is a town house converted into a hotel. Obviously all the rooms arent going to be big but they do say this on the site. Our room was really beautiful and was spacious with a little chair and table by the window. The bathroom was small but it was expected so we werent disappointed. The shower head lit up to the temperature of the water and there were twinkling lights even in the shower. The blackout curtains are simply amazing, along with super comfy bed and there were almost 100 TV channels to choose from in which some you could change the language. The staff were all very sweet and always smiled and greeted us. We ate at the Pizza restaurant across the road one night and it was lovely. The woman that ran it was so nice and the food was amazing... if you want a nice cheap meal in paris with service with a smile then this is the place to go. If you are looking for a quirky hotel in Paris at a good price then this is the place to go, I know some of the rooms are small but do you really need a huge amount of space in Paris when there is so much to do and see? We would go definitely go stay there again.. we are actually thinking of going back for a night in early september. T

Reviews.Title: “A compact room in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: GeoffLevett
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Paris to do some research at the Biblioteque Nationale and another archive. I needed a room that was close to the BNF but also easy to get to from the Gare du Nord. My usual hotel was fully booked for July so this was the first time that I stayed at The Five which is just around the corner. The hotel is easy to get to from the Gare du Nord - a quick trip on RER B to Port Royal and then a five minute walk and you're at the hotel. Buses from the door take you one way to the BNF and the other way direct to St Michel or the Louvre. The welcome at the hotel was efficient, friendly and they didn't mind letting me practice my terrible French. The room was small but since I was travelling alone it wasn't a problem, I wasn't intending to play basketball in there. A decent TV at the end of the bed, a compact bathroom (if you're hugely overweight it might be a problem, for most people it would be fine), a comfortable bed, air-conditioning and (best of all) free wi-fi meant that the room was ideal for me. Let's be clear, it wouldn't be ideal if you were on honeymoon and intended to spend a lot of time in bed, or if you were travelling with your kids. This hotel (or what I saw of it) is mainly set up for short breaks by singles or couples and it achieves its aim admirably. Cleanliness was excellent - the room was tidied each day in the afternoon. The only time I'd have breakfast in a hotel in Paris nowadays would be if I was having breakfast in bed with my wife. Otherwise it's pointless. There is ALWAYS a café nearby that will give you as good a service at a cheaper cost. In a city like London or Paris space is money and hotels will not put their breakfast rooms in the most pleasant part of the building unless you're paying extra for that through your room rate. Checking out was simple, the bill was reasonable and overall I had a thoroughly positive experience. It's more than likely that I'll stay there again when next I go to Paris. I notice that they are opening a new hotel around the corner (The Seven?), which looks a little bigger. A couple of recommendations if you're staying at The Five... 1) The cinema across the road (L'Escurial) is a wonderful room to spend an hour or two in if you want to escape the weather or you're at a loose end in the evening. A genuinely mixed clientèle with an old-fashioned vibe. 2) Le Café D'Avant on the corner of Rue Bernard is ideal for eating from breakfast till late. The owner is a credit to his trade and it was pleasing to see that he was nice and busy when I visited during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST & SMALLEST ROOM EVER”
Reviews.Author: pingabb
Reviews.Content: This is probably the smallest room we've stayed at during our 2 weeks trip in Europe. For a hotel that charges such a price, this certainly is not worth a penny of the value. The room is smaller than possibly imagine...basically...two people standing straight is all that you can really do. The washroom...is just tiny, with only a small sink and no room for toiletries, towels, toothpaste, etc. If you are claustrophobic, than I would not suggest you come any where near the hotel. In addition, for a hotel that is consider young, things are already breaking in the rooms with no repairs made. I guess maintenance is not an priority for the hotel. Then the website. You see wonderful pictures of a world class luxury design hotel, with exceptional design and quality, but when you get here, you will know the website is deceiving. It is far from the truth. I would NOT SUGGEST this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: TeamSawesome
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked to stay at the Seven Hotel, the newest venture of the Five. However, due to unforeseen circumstances they were unable to open in time for our reserved arrival and called days before to inform us of such. In lieu, they put us up for free for the entire duration of our trip in the Five. Amazing customer service, very clean, and although the rooms were small they were beautiful with french doors that open to a quiet courtyard. For us, it was the perfect stay in Paris and while it was not "central" there were numerous beautiful places to be discovered in the area. C'est Magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “absolute no value for money !”
Reviews.Author: RalphParis
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms - you can easily jump from the door into your bed ... The curtains are closed when you enter the room so you can't see that your staying in an ugly street. The bathroom can't be used by two at the same time unless one of you stays in the shower... Every picture of the hotel, the room, the reception is unrealistic and misleading. The hotel is kitsch en certainly no design. Breakfast is in the basement. I can onlly think of one positive thing : they are friendly. Guess other hotels where you pay 230 € per night are friendly too...

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, romantic, small and very French.”
Reviews.Author: mattkorey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was French in all the good ways and none of the bad ones you hear about. You have to just be ready for the fact that the rooms are small. They are really small. But they are so festive and unique with the LED starlight effects and hand made designs sprinkled throughout. The staff were warm, kind and chatty (anti-French!) and had a bottle of champagne waiting for my partner's birthday as a lovely welcoming gift. The rose petals sprinkled over the bed are a nice tough as we all need to have that experience a few times in our lives I hope. We loved the the cozy feel of the room and burrowing into our nest there after being out all day. Located in the 6th Disctrict, it is not to far to the Rue Mouffetard where all the restaurants and hustle and bustle can be found, including our favorite crepe place. We went there for breakfast since I'm not sure whose idea it was to put the hotel's breakfast room in a hot basement; the only misstep I can see that The Five has made. Being that it's Paris, there are plenty of bakeries around anyway to have a delicious croissant. Oui to the The Five.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely unforgettable for all the GOOD reasons - a Parisien Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ruthsillars
Reviews.Content: It should be said that rooms are petite but everything else about this place is immense! My partner surprised me with a 3 night stay in the Superior Suite which has comfy lounge space, luxuous bedroom, spacious bathroom (with bath and infectious lights), cute garden balcony and of course the famous hot tub! The woah factor is there from word go on the discreet parisien side street, to the welcoming, informative and genuine front of house staff, to the funky design touches in the lighting (multi-coloured LEDs set into the walls, ceilings and bathrooms for a real under the stars experience!), to the luxurious decor throughout, the comfortable and ample bed, the garden space for those pre-dinner champagne drinks, the relaxing hot tub and bathroom access for those intimate tete-a-tetes at the end of a fantastic day in Paris. The hotel is immaculately clean and although there was no mini-bar in the room staff were genuinely available at any time to organise whatever your palette desired. The patisserie on the corner has some of the best macarons I've ever tasted and the hotel breakfasts were copious and fresh - perfect in the sunny garden space accessed from our room. The nearest metro is a 10 minute walk and offers you access to the rest of the RER and metro network, also from the city centre taxis were very reasonable. I have stayed in a number of Paris hotels and although I would agree they were larger in the m the staff and hotel themselves are nothing in comparison to the Five. This is genuine Paris hotel and is just far enough from the tourist spots that you don't feel part of the crowd but close enough to be home in 20 minutes from the centre. I would highly recommend the suite which although slightly more expensive is absolutely worth it. It was the perfect surprise romantic weekend away which led up to the most thoughtful and unforgettable marriage proposal I could have ever hoped for! Thanks again to all the staff at the Five who helped ensure our trip was a truly Parisien Paradise and we look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice funky hotel. Location is good but not fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: MassiG
Reviews.Content: The Five hotel is really nice, the rooms are different, with lots of nice touches ( I had a lot of interesting fiber optics). My room was small - but could cope with it. The location is good, although it is not on the most convenient of Metro lines - so not super central. Nonetheless good location. My only annoyance was the poor soundroofing of the hotel. I could hear people from the next room, and walking from upstairs. Not a major drama - but would be nice to have a little bit more quietness

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, LITTLE hotel”
Reviews.Author: bela492005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early May during our first visit to Paris. We had booked the hotel through Expedia after reading reviews on here that the hotel was good. The service was great - we arrived early and they took our luggage and suggested some restaurants in the area to go grab lunch. The area around the hotel is quiet and it is located on a small quiet street near residences. When we arrived back to the hotel, the front desk staff told us that our room was ready and our luggage was up there already. When we opened the door to our room, we could not believe how tiny the room was. The room we had was decorated in a contemporary/modern style and it was extremely clean, which sort of made up for the size of the room. There was barely enough room for my husband and I to move around the room without bumping into each other. The bathroom was the tiniest bathroom ever with the tiniest sink and shower. We knew that hotel rooms would not be the same size in big European cities but this room seemed extremely small. We did move to another hotel after a few days in another area of Paris (which had a higher rate as well) and the room at that hotel was almost twice the size of the hotel room we had at the Five Hotel. The bed was comfortable and the room was pitch dark at night. Also, it was extremely quiet - there was no audible noise from outside traffic, etc. Free wi-fi was available as well which was offered when we checked in for all of our devices. L'Occitane products were supplied as well, which was a nice touch. The location of the hotel room was OK but was not really that close to the "happening" areas. It was a bit of a walk to the closest Metro station. There is a wonderful patisserie right next to the hotel with the most amazing sweets! I would not recommend this hotel to a friend and would suggest that they pay a bit more to be in a better location and have a room with a bit more space.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paulh8280
Reviews.Content: Stayed in The Five Hotel whilst in Paris to see Michael Buble (show was cancelled!). The location is first class....direct train on the RER B line from CDG - 40 minute journey time to Port Royal station - then a 5 minute walk from the station. Easy access in to the centre of Paris and all of the sites from Les Gobelins metro station. There are some lovely cafes, restaurants and patisseries along Port Royal, which add to the chic French feel to the area. Check in was a breeze, which is just what you need after a day of travelling. Although rooms are on the small side (typical in Paris), they were spotlessly clean and well laid out. We had the Superior Baldaquin room, and had a window that opened out onto the street below, which was great for watching Paris drift by in the afternoon before heading out for dinner. The bedding was sumptuous and allowed for the most comfortable nights sleep I have had in a hotel for a long time. Overall a great stay, in a nice hotel, in a wonderful location, in a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: mking99
Reviews.Content: An exotic little hotel in Paris. A hotel that stands out in its design. Above all the quality of the service in excellent. A hotel that makes you feel a ease and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational!”
Reviews.Author: Paulos98
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Five in the midst of the volcano eruption in April and was worried about how I could get back to Australia via Rome. The room I picked was small, but very tidy and very modern. The wonderful front desk staff (tthanks Tanya!!!) searched on the web for me, found a share car to Rome the next day (the last one), negotiated with the driver and organised everything. It was a really fun drive too! The service was absolutely sensational. I would recommend Five to anyone travelling to Paris. Great room - great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, staff are wonderful, rooms very compact, location good.”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan2010
Reviews.Content: We had a fabuous long weekend in Paris from 24th-27th April when thankfully the flights were back on. The staff were exceptional in this hotel. There is no bar but on arrival we were told to request tea, coffee, hot chocolate at any time and it would be provided. We did every day and getting a gorgeous mug of hot chocolate brought to our room at 1am after a birthday night out was great. My husband was even given a complimentary bottle of champagne on his birthday! The rooms are small but the lights are very novel, especially leds in the shower and the shower head which changes colour!!! Definitely worth a trip with a loved one. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “FIVE THUMBS UP”
Reviews.Author: oraclesingapore
Reviews.Content: 1. Responsive staff who speak fluent English 2. Responsible manager who is helpful 3. Accessible location near Metro and RER 4. Small but well designed room for more than comfortable stay 5. Nice toiletries and Lift facilities What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “amazing service, tiny rooms, location OK”
Reviews.Author: elphabalondon
Reviews.Content: Having read most of the tripadvisor reviews before visiting the hotel with my boyfriend I was well prepared for the extremely small size of the rooms/bathrooms, so that wasnt a surprise at all. The nice surprise was that we were upgraded the minute we arrived, and also we were given the room from noon, rather than 4pm when check in normally begins. That was especially great becuase we were so tired from an early train. The room was very clean, sheets and towels really good but becuase of the small size it's not somewhere where you want to spend any extra minutes other than sleeping and getting ready to go out. As we booked the hotel through a very cheap eurostar package, we felt it was worth the fact that it wasnt as central. Overall, we definitely suggest the hotel to those who can find a very cheap deal and dont mind walking those extra minutes on their way back after a long day touring. Breakfast-wise, as many others who wrote reviews here, we preferred to eat out, at the nice cafes of Rue Muffetard that is only 5 minutes walk away and where its cheaper and out in the sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “loved the staff especially Tanya, the rooms were a bit too small.”
Reviews.Author: NYMsoto
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were a bit surprised over how small the room was. we barely had enough room to walk around the room. While they were clean, and the beds were comfy, the rooms themselves were too small for a couple. especially a couple where one member was 6'7. we werent in the room most of the time but did feel the noise in the am was too loud (from both housekeeping and guest coming and going) which was inevitable as the rooms are so small. The bathroom was the biggest concern as there were no hooks to hang both towels and toiletries in an already very crowded space. On the plus side, Tanya was amazing. Always helpful and beyond accomodating. The staff and cleanliness alone are reasons why I would reccommend to those traveling alone on a budget. If the rooms were larger I would definitely return. the location was a bit far but within 5 min walking distance to the metro .

Reviews.Title: “The Service was totally top notch !”
Reviews.Author: lscrivy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we were on our honeymoon. The staff upgraded our room to a glimmering room, which was beautiful ! When we arrived at the hotel, they had rose petals strewn across our bed. They sent a bottle of champagne to our room. Our first morning there, they sent a complimentary breakfast tray to our room that was more than we could possibly eat ! Tonya, the clerk that we dealt with most often, spoke flawless English. They catered to our every whim. We could not have asked for a better experience. The staff was very friendly and always willing to tell us the best metro line to take to get wherever we needed to go. The room was tiny by American standards but we expected that. (Don't expect to take any showers together ... and don't drop the soap while you are in the shower - there's barely enough room to bend down to pick it up ! ) But aside from the size of the room, the furnishings were modern and plush and the hotel is in a nice, safe, convenient location in the Latin Quarter. The linens on the bed were sumptuous and there were four nice pillows on the bed, not just two. The bed was much too firm for my preference, but my husband slept just fine. There was not anything the staff could do about the firmness of the mattress, so there was no need to complain about it. There are no vending machines in the hotel - it is a small, boutique hotel - but the staff always provided soft drinks or water at no charge when we asked for something to drink. We were there a week and the only thing "extra" that we were charged for was when they graciously sent our laundry out for us at our request. There are two restaurants directly across the street from the hotel, so when we were too tired to go out at night, we just went across the street. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough - the staff was wonderful and the rooms, though small, were exceptional. If you are considering this hotel, do not hesitate. Definitely five stars for The Five Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “cute, warm, clean, a little small but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet_voyager
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in november. The room was small (expectedly in paris, no place for walking:P) but the bathroom was great. And also the small occitane pack. The little lights in shower was so cute. Internet was free and with a good speed. TV was LCD. The reception was warm and welcoming. No prb during stay. we didn't have breakfast, it was a little expensive for us. But the overall ambiance was clean and chic. Getting to and from the hotel is easy. You can reach to the hotel by walking a few minutes from a metro station. you can even walk up from st.michel boulv. But I think you can find less expensive hotels with this properties.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic and charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cupcakesandart
Reviews.Content: colorful, cozy, charming, adorable place. we got great sleep. fantastic staff, especially joelle and tanya, very helpful. Walk to the rue de moufftarde fro somehting yummy to eat and very good pizza right across the street. the place smells incredible! it is a quiet and hip little place. loved the led lights agaisnt the black shower. people complain about the small size but my hub and i are typical grande americans and we had plenty of room! ha. i did not realize there was room servide until the alst day, so make sure you order something if you want it. the beds are soft and the pillows are fluffy. we went for my 40th birthday and for valentine's day and i would not change a thing! we had a beautiful time. fantastic place, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip to paris thanks to my stay at this amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Evam88
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Five Hotel and was very very happy of my stay there. Indeed we booked the "Superior Glimmering Room" and were utterly satisfied by our choice. The staff was welcoming and the hotel is located in a charming area. Will definitely come back!!!! Thank you so much again for everything!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but quite out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: DiManMilan
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very small, and does not look so great when you first enter. Maybe this is also due to the fact that during our stay there were construction works which involved part of it. The room was also very small but perfectly decorated. The bed was hanging from the ceiling, where a system of optic fibers recreated a night sky with stairs. The same optical effect was also in the bathtub offering a unique experience when showering. When we stayed the heater was not working and the personnel installed a portable heater in the room, offering us two small bottles of champagne. Besides this, the personnel was very efficient and helpful. The only down side is the location, which is in a quite neighbourhood but a little out of the way, especially since it was clearly advertised as being in the Latin Quarter (technically it was in that quarter but in the outer rim). I would definitely recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Incredible atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MStyle
Reviews.Content: I planned a weekend holiday in the Ville Lumière with my Parisian girlfriend. Having been several times in Paris for both work and pleasure, I visited different hotels in the past, but this time I let my girlfriend choose, relying on the knowledge only a native can have about the best places to stay in his city. This hotel has proved to be a great surprise and a top new entry in my personal list. It is located in the 5th arrondissement, the street is very quite and the neighbourhood truly exclusive, with Jardin du Luxembourg 10 minutes on foot from there and the metro line 7 just 500 metres away. The room interior is modern and comfortable, it's characterized by colour changing LED lights which contribute to create a magical atmosphere. We had no problem with the room space, in the same range as other hotels' belonging to this class and, in addition, the cleanliness was remarkable. The staff was great, very warm and friendly, and obviously wondeful in English speaking but, less predictable, also very fluent in Italian. I'll definitely stay in the Five Hotel again in the future, I think it's quality/price ratio is hardly beatable.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located boutique hotel with modern decor...”
Reviews.Author: Tabibito_10
Reviews.Content: Tiny boutique hotel with a very modern touch. Loved the modern decor of the rooms, though the room size is smaller than any hotel in Tokyo, New York or London :) The bathroom is very small but beautiful with nice lights all over. Walking distance to many coffee shops in the area, train station and to Seine. Nice Japanese pastery shop around the corner. 15 min walk to St. Germain des Pres. Excellent quiet location to enjoy Paris in the day time as well at night.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings but overall I can't recommend.”
Reviews.Author: p_sf
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 nights at The Five based on TripAdvisor reviews and a special the hotel was offering - stay 6 nights and get 1 (or was it 2?) nights free. As my title indicates I have very mixed feelings. First, the good: unlike several other reviewers, I was thrilled with the location of the hotel (although my girlfriend was not). It's in a quiet neighborhood, with a few tourists wandering around with suitcases but for the most part it seems to be almost exclusively residential. It's a 5 minute walk to Les Gobelins, and from there only 5 or 6 stops to the more central areas where tourists will want to spend their time. For me that was ideal; I rather enjoy staying a little bit away from the action. I also liked a couple eateries in the area, particularly Brasserie aux Marsouins (sp?) right across the street. They're friendly, have great coffee, a good beer selection, and decent food. We had breakfast there most mornings, and I finished my day with a beer of glass of wine there most evenings. Just down the street towards the metro station there is a great ramen shop called Yo Yo, and right next door to the hotel is a pricey but outstanding niche bakery called Patisserie Aoki. If you do stay at The Five definitely try something from Aoki. Now on the the negatives. Small, very very small. Smaller than you can imagine, smaller than everyone says. Believe the reviews, then shrink your mental image by 1/3. We had a mid-sized room with a queen bed, and it was tiny tiny tiny. They do provide a small wardrobe but it's SO small that there is barely room enough to hang two coats, let alone a few shirts or dresses in addition. I could live with the small room, but the bathroom, and particularly the shower, was nearly unusable. I'm not a big guy (5'9", 165 lbs) but even I couldn't properly shower because the stall is so small. I didn't measure but I'm sure it's LESS than 3' x 3' square. There is literally barely enough room to turn around. The pillows are also absolutely horrible, for ANY hotel, let alone a hotel charging these rates. They were old beaten up foam pillows the insides of which were nothing but tiny foam balls. It felt like sleeping on a bean bag chair. (The bed however was quite nice!) Also the amenities in the bathroom are less than what I would expect at a youth hostel. Plastic cups? And paper-thin ratty towels? Are you kidding? And, of course, no mini-bar as others have mentioned. For a hotel that seems to be so keen on cashing in (by using plastic cups and sh*tty pillows and towels), you'd think the proprietors would figure out they could make even MORE money buy installing minibars in the rooms. Overall, thumbs down for The Five. It's a nice idea, the design is also quite nice, but function should be be at a certain base level before you splurge on form. The Five seems to have sacrificed function so they can cash in on form. Not a winning formula for me, especially at such a price premium. I won't stay here again, and I unfortunately can't recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Better than many four or five star hotels!”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreKerry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Five Hotel for our Wedding Anniversary and it was really special. OK the rooms are small but the scented lamps in the rooms, the L'occitaine products in the bathroom, quirky lighting - even the shower head had lights - more than made up for it. The staff were amazingly friendly - even giving us a bottle of champagne and complimentary breakfast because it was our anniversary. Location is great - you can walk anywhere from the hotel - but not too close, so we got to discover many hidden treasures, like the Sunday market outside the church nearby. We will definitely be back. Can't wait

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: bluelight_solutions
Reviews.Content: We first turned up at Residence Henri IV and hated it so much we left immediately. Consequently, we went out looking for alternatives. We were lucky enough to stumble on The Five Hotel, which was a breath of a fresh air compared to Residence Henri IV and our experience there. The service was fantastic, and we were made to feel very welcomed, especially since it was my partner's first visit to Paris and her birthday, so we wanted to make it special. The manager, a friendly and lovely lady, offered us the floating room, which was spectacular. Not only that, but she also found us a great deal at the Hidden Hotel (as she didn't have rooms available for our entire stay). She was so very lovely and we highly recommend staying here - we'll definitely be coming back on our next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely night in another world”
Reviews.Author: emzoler
Reviews.Content: I wanted to treat my girlfriend to an amazing night in Paris. Even though I live here there's nothing like staying the hotel for a night for something special. The One Suite was absolutely amazing. It's like leaving this world and entering a soft world of love and care. The staff were great, smiling and friendly all the time. The suite was impeccable. And an experience of it's own. I strongly advice it to anyone who wants to try something different!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel especially if you are a smurf!”
Reviews.Author: theroamerIreland
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to state that we had a really nice stay at the Five Hotel. The location is nice and quiet but for some may be a bit far away from the action. The Metro Gobelins in only a few minutes walk away and the RER Port Royal is also quite close but definitely further than the Metro. The staff are very friendly and gave us plently of tips on shopping locations away from the main centres. The rooms are really nicely decorated and are very clean but the size can be a big problem. We stayed in room 602 (top floor - standard room). The toilet and the shower area are seperate but im sure they could have used the space better. Beware anyone over 6'3 - you will not be able to use the toilet in the normal manner. It is in a room 2 ft 5" x 2ft5'"so i had to sit on it side ways with the door open (not very practical) however my wife got a good laugh! We are not very picky travellers and have stayed in paris before so we know what size of rooms to expect but this one pushed our limits a bit too far. Just make sure you book one of the larger suites if you are tall. Otherwise all smurf's welcome at room 602!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: chiloeBarcelona
Reviews.Content: As I'm traveling to Paris for Business (and leisure) 2 to 3 times a month, I've already tried a lot of Parisian hotels and after several years this one is still one of my favorites : the Staff is incredibly kind, always smiling, helpful and, most important, efficient.(those who need a taxi at 8 AM in Paris will understand me!) Location is quiet and the rooms have style. (yes, rooms are small...well, it is very common in Paris). Plus it is value for money. In conclusion, I definitively recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Tiny hotel which does not cater for any of the senses!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelTrip
Reviews.Content: The Five Hotel is in the 5th Arrondissement of Pars – the Latin Quarter. Unfortunately what they don’t tell you is that it at the furthest edge from the centre of Paris and quite a walk to get to anywhere you might want to visit. However its around 20 minute walk to Pantheon. There is a metro station nearby. Apart from the location I was really excited to stay at this hotel because I was looking forward to a few days away in style and luxury - my 5 senses treated just as the hotel promised. First of all the rooms are absolutely tiny – smaller than the smallest room I have ever stayed in Paris. I went to the reception and enquired because I had booked a superior room – I was told I was give the largest room in the hotel other than a suite! As for the five senses – visually there are some LED lights on the bed canopy and in the shower, there is some lacquer artwork which personally I did not find pleasing to the eye; as for the sense of hearing, the hotel promised a quiet time but being situated right above the reception – we could always hear what was going on down there, plus someone was always hovering right around the corner from us; for the sense of smell, we were promised rose petals on the bed which we did find however these were fake with no smell to them whatsoever; as for sense of touch, I must admit the bed was very comfortable; sense of taste – there wasn’t even a minibar in the room and no chocolate on the bed, plus the breakfast was extra so we always went out to eat. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel unless you want to stay outside the centre and want a tiny room with a few LED lights. In my opinion this is not a 4 star hotel and I will not stay there again. The receptionist were very polite.

Reviews.Title: “My cat loved it”
Reviews.Author: TripyJ
Reviews.Content: due to the fact I could not swing her in the room. The rooms are tiny and the bathroom is partically part of the room. The Hotel is located on a street unheard of by the locals. The directions on the hotel page should read "Turn left when you exit Port Royal train station - Go past the hospital and rue flandres is the second left on your left" The receptionist could not find our booking originally - then mysteriously changed our room after allocating one to us. Don't bother upgrading to the superior as if ours was the superior (doubtful) the standard could not be any worse. As for the 'Magic Lights' - Lights behind drilled MDF - spec tacky lour.

Reviews.Title: “Typically Small Paris Room but Amazing Contemporary Charm”
Reviews.Author: dsnyder8600
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Five Hotel. If you go into it accepting the fact that Paris hotel rooms are traditionally very small - especially if you are used to American hotel rooms - then you gain the ability to look past the size of the rooms and recognize all of the things the Five has to offer. The hotel is super contemporary which we just loved. The LED lighting scattered throughout the room and bathroom was a wonderful touch. The location was awesome as far as we were concerned - definitely out of the way from the majority of Paris attractions, which means the area stayed quiet and comfortable and more "real" Paris. However, Paris' public transportation system is so awesome that you can quickly get to any of the top Paris attractions in a quick 10-15 minutes. The staff was absolutely fantastic, as well - wonderful English and extremely willing to help point us in the direction of anything we wanted to find. We will definitely stay at The Five Hotel again the next time we are in Paris and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: GaryM27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the middle of September 09. It seemed to be a good time of the year to visit Paris. Nice weather. It was at the tail end of the tourist season, so it wasn't as crowed. This hotel was perfect for me. Friendly staff, nice quiet room and a large enough bed to hold my six foot four frame. Size of the room was fine. Since I traveled alone, I didn't need a whole lot of space to begin with. The bathroom is a bit tight, but not a problem. The water pressure of the shower is actually stronger than mine at home, which was a shock and welcoming after long LONG long walks in Paris. Location was great. I was only a few minutes walk between the RER C train and the metro. Not too far from the big sites, and a great place to just wander around. Just walking through the markets was one of the highlights of my trip. But the best part of this hotel was its staff. One of the clerks actually phoned my shuttle for me and got on their case over the phone when they hadn't arrived on time. There's nothing like someone sticking up for you, especially when your French speaking skills aren't parfait. The next time I vacation in Paris, I will definitely go back to this hotel. ps. the hotel was VERY clean, and the maids were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A great place, convenient to public transportation and all that Paris has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: GlynnDavid
Reviews.Content: A small, intimate yet trending feeling hotel, with a very nice and helpful staff. The rooms are small, as are most hotel rooms in Paris, but still comfortable. You wouldn't be happy there if you spend a lot of time in your room, but then again, why would you be in Paris if you are sitting in your room the entire time. The hotel is located close to the Metro (7/pink line) so it is convenient to getting anywhere in metro Paris. The neighborhood is quiet and charming ...away from the tourist centers and not crazy with traffic or noise. A taste of real Paris. It was a perfect place for my partner and I on his first visit to the best city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy calm after a rock festival”
Reviews.Author: rurz
Reviews.Content: After visiting the Rock en Seine music festival, and spending 3 days in a very dusty tent, anything would have done, but the free upgrade, disco shower, petal covered bed and good location made this hotel even better! Very funky, very cool but not condescending, even when you arrived covered in dust carrying a backpack and a tent! Small rooms, but very very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Five Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Killpop
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Five Hotel in the Superior Glimmering for 5 nights. It was fantastic! The atmosphere was great: the amazing scents in both the lobby and the room; the lovely and unique room and bathroom; the helpful, sweet and friendly staff... We loved the location; since it wasn't our first time in Paris we wanted to discover the non touristy parts of Paris (such as the streets of the Latin Quarter and Marais for example) so we didn't mind that the hotel was located far away (on foot) from the main attractions. Very easy to get to different sights by walk or by using the metro which is about 10 mins away on foot. We had such a lovely stay in Paris and the Five Hotel!! We will definitely be returning again!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: markinsuffolk73
Reviews.Content: We booked a short stay at the 5 Hotel and could not fault it! Although it is a fair stomp away from the main sights of Paris it is well served by the Metro. The room was compact but was fine for us - the bed was very comfortable and the lighting made it feel like we were sleeping underneath the stars. Cool shower too. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and our room was ready for us despite our early arrival. We would thoroughly recommend staying here (provided you have some good walking shoes!!)

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Stay in The Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: abw75
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Five Hotel was nothing but exceptional. The rooms were a bit on the small side (American Standard) but when in Paris, why worry about the size of the room. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a welcome reception, clean and hospitable hotel in the Latin Quarter. If you are looking for a spacious room, this is not the place for you. We did have a double room, not sure what the suites look like. But I would stay at this hotel again, hands down, one of the most pleasant hotel stays I have had in all my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: princessvandal
Reviews.Content: Got a really cheap deal on this hotel from Eurostar.co.uk, and as far as value for money goes, this was amazing. The rooms are really well decorated, with sparkly lights on the headboard of the bed, desk, and in the shower, and the shower even lights up all different colours when you turn it on! Only complaint was that the room was tiny! But it wasn't a problem as everything else made up for it. If you are a very tall person though I probably wouldnt recommend it! The bed was SO comfy, and the pillows were very fluffy! Which is very important! Also the staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellent english. The location of the hotel was quite good aswel, not exactly right in the heart of the city, but there are lots of restaurants nearby. One night we missed the last Metro and decided to walk all the way back to the hotel from the Eiffel tower, which probably took us about an hour! We will definately be staying here again. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “A good little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: smoothtalk
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here on the strength of reviews I'd read on this very site. I was not disappointed, though that was partly because I managed to secure an excellent deal by booking online. Under the circumstances my expectations were not immense, and they were more than met. This is very much a boutique hotel. It's not especially close to the Metro, but is in a fairly quiet location not far from vibrant Rue Mouffetard. The room I had was very small, and the shower room almost comically small, but the quality of the fixtures and fittings was high, the room was comfortable (even if I might not have relished sharing it!), and the staff at the hotel were without exception friendly and helpful. Overall, a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gianfrancooo
Reviews.Content: The room was big enough to crash out in after sightseeing all day, was spotlessly clean and had really funky, modern fittings and decor. We decided to have breakfast in the hotel every morning as, for 12 euros, it was great value compared to the cafes nearby. You get an extensive selection of fruit, pastries, cold meats etc and can eat as much as you like ( I did). The staff were very friendly and helpful and gave good guidance on places to eat, taxis, markets etc etc. Only downside was that I couldn't access the supposed WiFi internet- but i didn't try too hard or ask the staff; so it might work.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: nopesar
Reviews.Content: Very chic decor. Good location - residential area and yet minutes from subway and Latin Quarter. Be warned - shower cubicle is very small. For a small Asian like me, I can hardly move inside the cubicle !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,smallest bathroom ever.”
Reviews.Author: nednil_aisog
