Reviews.Content: The Hotel was lovely , we were in room 304 which was small but for 3 nights was enough. It had nice light fittings in room and in bathroom, very clean and modern. Houskeeping staff was doing great job. Our room was always clean and the scent was very nice. The only thing we were not happy about was lenght of the bed and bathroom. My partner is quite tall (196 cm) bed was only 190 cm long. Bathroom was the tiniest i've ever seen. My partner could hardly fit into a shower. To be fair water in shower was always hot. Sink didn't have plug and water in tap was cold so he couldn't shave.Bathroom very clean and modern with funky lights just very very small. I read all the reviews about this hotel and I would definitely give it a shot. We enjoyed our stay very much! I would definitely come back to this hotel and i would recommend it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Love it... but small and pricey rooms”
Reviews.Author: manywhere
Reviews.Content: This place is very lovely, and what you will see in other reviews is definitively true: the hotel is well located, great boutique hotel atmosphere, very nice staff, etc. But... the rooms are very small (even for Paris standard), and prices remain high... My conclusion: go there if you can catch a good deal (they sometimes have some on their website), or if you want to impress your partner for Valentine Day!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: chaz1234
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped foot in the door at reception we were made to feel like VIP's. We took the suite on the ground floor which was just perfect, it had minnie living room then you stepped into your main bedroom which was all lit up with fairy lights on the walls and ceilings! you could control this too which was good, and inbetween you had bathroom which had the most amazing shower that lit up when you used it ! we had showers in the dark it was that much fun seeing the lights. Outside in the garden you had hot-tub which fitted 4 people so loads of room for just two !! overall it was very romaintic just one problem and that was leaving it to go sightsee !! it was quite expensive at £300 per night but for the whole novelty it was just perfect for one off.. Big thanks to Tanya who had perfect English and was very very helpful and friendly and made us both feel very special on our honeymoon so Thank you Tanya ..

Reviews.Title: “some pros and cons - for me the cons are stronger...”
Reviews.Author: guyIsrael
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because of tripadvisor reviews. So here is my take - all in all I wouldn't return, but I should start with the positive - most of the staff is really nice and helpful! Much attention was given to detail, all in good taste and charm!!! This is what I looked for - and the hotel stood up to its promise. the problem? room size: ok - so I took a "standard" and one should be responsible for one's choices. but I didn't realize how small "small" can be. True - the price was good, but it is depressing. If you open the window curtains - people from the opposite apartments can look at you - so the room is kept shut dark most of the time. So if you think the hotel offers a good deal for its unique design, and you are looking at a standard room price - then in my wholly subjective view - it was not worth it. If they would pull together two "standard rooms" - you would get a rather adequate (although still on the small side) room. But splitting a decent size room into two is a bit of a ... location: a matter of personal preference. it's paris, everything is walking distance or metro. But still - it's not the place to go out of your hotel at night time and just be in the middle of it all (and there are so many venues in Paris that do qualify for that). finally on the cons - all the "5 senses" thing: too exaggerated and too much of a marketing issue. The design is very nice!! don't need to make it into something it is not... It is the kind of hotel for which i feel bad providing a mediocre review. They did everything right , the staff was wonderful, it is the kind of small hotels I like. But an expanded broom closet is not a room. When you get the feeling that they make money by cutting down rooms to the tiniest size possible (and it really couldn't be any smaller...) - the other goodies, attention and design just don't make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “High five for The Five”
Reviews.Author: France2009Canada
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at The Five Hotel in Paris. Needless to say, we were very impressed with everything from the location to the style of the rooms, the service and the awesome in-room breakfast. This hotel fit the bill without a doubt. We would absolutely return when in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Latogato
Reviews.Content: it was a great experience to stay in your hotel. the staff is very friendly. when i come to paris next time, i´ll surely stay at the five hotel. even for business the hotel is a cool place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “SEXY, Stylish, Sophisticated chic hotel with Savvy staff ready to help”
Reviews.Author: ParisPatsy
Reviews.Content: I've never taken the time to write a review of a hotel, but The Five deserves it. Yes, it is small, but the style of it and the sexy rock star design/attitude/decor is well worth it the trade off. The staff was absolutely fabulous, helpful, knowledgeable, friendly, and welcoming. The location is just what the Doctor ordered to really soak in Paris and enjoy the less touristy side of this very sexy city. If you want space, stay at The Ritz, but it doesn't hold a candle to the hot, chic, glamorous style of The Five. That disco-lit shower was fantastic, that alone is worth staying there for - woo hoo! THANK YOU !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but very very small”
Reviews.Author: Heracles
Reviews.Content: We 've stayed with my wife for three nights. Its location is great since you are in a central spot of Paris (quartier Latin) and there many inderesting places to go in walking distance. The breakfast was very good from the quality point of view, but there was not satisfactory variety. The service was good and the stuff was friendly. The whole hotel was very nice decorated. But the main problem was the size of everything in there - Everything was tiny!! The room, the bed, the shower, the desk ! You couldn't feel confortable unless you where less than 1.5m tall. I have stayed in many boutique hotels, but I have never seen such a small room. If they have tried to make 2 rooms per floor instead of four the things would be much better. So be carefull before you book, since the rooms look larger in the internet site than they really are.

Reviews.Title: “Cool At First Glance - Not Great Once You Stay There”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a group of 5 related hotels (I asked and found out they are related because they share some of the same owners). I stayed here recently after trying one of the other hotels in the group. The Web site makes this hotel look A LOT better and bigger than it is in person. The ROOMS ARE TINY! I booked what was supposed to be a superior with a canopy room for 2 persons. It was somewhat on the expensive side but I thought from the Web site it would be great. It was not. The bathroom: no place to put your toiletries or anything really that you need in the bathroom. The bedroom: no real usable area for a desk to work at. Has free WiFi which is one of the few pluses. Has an in room safe but not large enough to put a laptop in. Also VERY concerned about security at this hotel. I woke up on my 3rd night there to the front desk night person opening my door (which had been bolted but does not include a security chain) and looking into the room. Of course i was deeply disturbed, called the front desk and was given no reason for this serious intrusion other than he made a "mistake." The morning front desk manager only offered to send champagne to my room - NOT GOOD. They should have comped a room night at the very least. The closest metro or RER stop is a little bit of a walk - buses do pass on the main blvd in front. Probably not the most convenient location if you are using public transport or even taxis for that matter. Not much by way of small stores nearby to buy water or food either that I could tell. All in all, I would not stay here again and found the value of the stay to be too much paid for what you actually received.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DM1981
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary and I hope we will be back in the near future. Yes the rooms are a little on the small side, but to be honest I have stayed in hotels in London that are no more spacious and this one is much better value for money. The location is excellent with an easy walk to the train station. Just two doors away from the hotel is a little patisserie that offers pastries that are nothing short of divine! On Port Royal on Saturday morning there is a market that sells all sorts of local delights. The staff in the hotel are simply wonderful, the hotel offers a free laptop to use and the staff even put up with my complete inability to switch it on!! If you are used staying the suite at The Ritz then this hotel will probably not rate very high in your eyes, however if you want a clean, friendly and quirky base to visit this magnificent city then I think it is one of the best around!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking”
Reviews.Author: susanrfs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to Paris staying at The Five. We knew ahead of time from Trip Advisor that the "standard room" would be small, but chose it because of the great price and because a standard room has one bed rather than two. (At least some superior rooms have two twin beds pushed together rather than one large bed and we did not want the two single bed arrangement.) If you care about having one bed, find out whether you would wind up getting two single beds pushed together if you book the roomier superior room. It may be that the only true large one bed is in the Deluxe room with the "deluxe" price. The standard room is comically small. The double bed is against the wall, and there is only two or three feet between the edge of the bed and the wall with the bath. The bathroom is triangular, with a tiny free standing sink about 9 inches round right next to the toilet. The shower is so small it isn't easy to get in and out using the folding door. It is the smallest room and bathroom I have seen in any hotel in 40 plus years of traveling. On a positive note, it did give me the idea of turning our tiny hall closet at home into a bathroom and gave us lots of laughs. It was hysterical trying to pass each other around the bed or in and out of the bathroom and we were constantly saying to each other, "beep beep." Oh, I should mention that we were sad to loose our tiny one foot area at the end of the bed because it was the only spot to put down our suitcases. It truly is a "cozy" room for one person only. When we arrived, there was no bar of soap in the room, and the person at the desk said, without an apology, "we ran out" before finally finding a bar to give to us. We went back to our room the following evening to find that the room had no toilet paper at all although the room had been made up, and we needed to get a roll from the desk. So, although the staff was friendly and nice and happy to make dinner recommendations, "service" can't be given high marks with the absence of a bar of soap one day and a lack of toilet paper the next. Meanwhile, the place shimmers and sparkles with artsy lights and whimsical decor. Guests can get a choice of "scent" for the room. Unfortunately, I was allergic to the smell in the room. We heard another guest sneezing, saying she was allergic also, and she offered me an antihistamine. The staff kindly eliminated the aroma immediately when we said it was a problem. The Hotel is officially in the 5th Arr., but it is on the last street, rue Port Royal, before the 5th ends and the 13th begins. Being far from the Left Bank action was not a problem in that a metro is nearby and the hotel is next to a wonderful old cobblestone street filled with great restaurants and cafes, with character and full of life. The location next to this street was the hotel's number one good feature and almost reason enough to think of going back. It was a joy to wander down that street towards the Seine and then have dinner outdoors in any one of the many good restaurants before returning to the room at night. We never tried the breakfast as it cost extra and was double the price of breakfast in any one of a number of cafes nearby. Also, the breakfast room is in the basement with no natural light. Although the decor is New Age and interesting, the room smelled of cleaning solution and eating in the basement is not nearly as nice as outdoors at a cafe. We asked if we could change to a bigger room, and the hotel was fully booked and so change was impossible for all but one night. The room that became available was so expensive (although a bed swinging from the ceiling sounded interesting and we sure could have used any inch of extra space) that we decided to stick with the small room for one more night. Perhaps if we had a larger room we would recommend the hotel to a friend, but we wouldn't recommend the hotel as we experienced it. All in all, and even with the problems described above, we had a fantastic time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: FunintheBigCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't look like much from the outside but it's what's on the inside that counts. The rooms are small, but for Paris they are about average, but the decoration really sticks out. The multicoloured shower head, the lights in the tiles, the hanging beads around the bed, the list goes on. I had a peek at others and they all appear to be different with all having their own individual statement. I love it. The immediate area doesn't have a great selection of services for the travellers but a few blocks away and there is soon plenty of choice. And who minds walking around in Paris? But in saying that I think the best macaroon shop sits on the corner at the end of the street (try the green tea or sesame ones). The staff were amazing, so helpful, and perfect English, so it saved my very bad French from embarrassing me. There aren't many rooms so getting a reservation can be a little tricky, so book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: LCaraway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few nights in the last of my time in Paris. The room was beautiful, and the bed was nice and soft. The room was a bit small, but by Paris standards this did not come as a surprise to me. It was such a nice experience with the decor in the rooms. The location was not far from metro stops, just a few minute walk away, and it was nice to come back to at the end of a night. The manager at reception helped a lot as well with printing some boarding passes I forgot to print myself, which was appreciated. The room also had free wifi which was a big bonus. The cost was a bit much overall, but it was a unique experience and I wish I would have tried the large deluxe suite they have.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and unusual boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyS
Reviews.Content: The Five Hotel was a perfect choice for a weekend in Paris. The room was small but beautifully and unusually decorated, with fairy lights aplenty and a bizarre and brilliant LED shower. Fantastic if - like me - you enjoy flamboyant design! The staff were delightful and had perfect English. The bed was very comfortable and the location is great: very close to the lovely Rue Mouffetard. In short, we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “absolute fantastic”
Reviews.Author: b2s
Reviews.Content: I am an interior designer myself so looking for an hotel i always try to find something special .I've stayed in many hotels(most of the time with all four if my children so more rooms are required) but the difference between the Five is simple this hotel is created and managed by people who love their job. proberly this concept brings next Five hotel to Champs elysees?

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolita54
Reviews.Content: I have spend 4 nights in The Five hotel, very nice rooms, I loved the magic atmosphere and the quiete area outside the hotel,walking 10 minutes till the" rue mouffetard", typically old french streets with restaurants and shops.I was in Paris for business reasons and I recommand this hotel for lovers.I hope next time to sleep in their suite " One by the five" that I have visited , an amazing room/appartment , so exceptionnal!

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE....”
Reviews.Author: SWEETLIFE92
Reviews.Content: I spend one night in the one by the five... I just want to say that the FIVE HOTEL is so amazing: - the staff is so cute and they are really taking care about everything.... - regarding the rooms, you won't find a hotel like this one in paris....this is so UNIQUE and so modern.... In my room i had a flying bed ( see attached picture )... you are sleeping in space....this is totaly crazy I recommand you to discover this beautiful and unique place in PARIS

Reviews.Title: “A romantic place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ItalianGoodLiving
Reviews.Content: We staied 5 days in march 2009. This tiny hotel is located near the metro staion Les Gobelins in the Latin Quarter. We chose a Glimmering Baldaquin Room: very romantic choice but really tiny; there's no space for your luggage and for your bath appareil in the toilet, but there's a very cool led shower. The staff is very kind but 'problem solving' it's another thing. We reccomend this hotel for romantic escape.... but only for slim people with light luggage ;-).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jazzfood
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent but the service was outstanding. The desk staff was helpful beyond what I'd normally expect and I'm in the business.

Reviews.Title: “We are disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LTim
Reviews.Content: We are disappointed. Hotel very small and, though also new, but uncomfortable. Our room Suite was on a ground floor, windows in a court yard. A room very small and only one small window. It was impossible to open curtains - because us it would be visible to everything, therefore in a room it was very dark. In a room one greater bed and two single beds. Is not present either sofas, or armchairs - to watch TV, it was necessary to sit on these beds which stood perpendicularly to a wall with the TV. Very inconveniently. The personnel makes impression very nonprofessional. There was a confusion and with settlement, and departure (the reception women could not make the invoice in any way, was mistaken). Breakfast in a cellar, in a close premise without windows. Very unfriendly and very slovenly woman at breakfast serves. A breakfast absolutely tasteless, we ate only in the first day. Shock for us was, when one of working women of hotel in for a breakfast collected on a tray a breakfast for someone from visitors - it was BAREFOOT, naked not too well-groomed legs to a floor! Appetite at us at once was gone. Somehow time in the afternoon (about 16 hours) we have come into our room. All in a room has been turned - beds are disassembled, the bed-clothes is removed from them (even it was impossible to enter). In a room there was a parlourmaid, it watches on the TV a soap opera. On our questions - that occurs - it did not answer. The woman from reception has come and has told, what will soon repair beds (why it could not be made when there have left the previous visitors? Us did not occupy in room till five o'clock), therefore the disorder. We have asked the cleaning woman to leave, as we needed to change clothes. She did not leave. We have asked once again, through the woman from reception. Cleaning woman all the same did not leave, and watched TV! Absolutely foolish situation - we are changing clothes, and she is siting on a bed and watching TV! The general opinion about hotel - all is very nonprofessionally, slovenly, inhospitably.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, je t´aime, The Five”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Kelso
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay in Paris, France. Stayed in the Five Hotel in the Latin Quarter. What should I say: the hotel has several advantages. First, the location in the Latin Quarter, close to a lot of restaurants and near a metro-station and only a short walk away from Jardin du Luxembourg or St. Germain-des-Pres. Second, perfect service and really nice people. Tanya and her team at the reception are perfect. If only every hotel had a team like The Five.......And third, the rooms: stylish and romantic at the same time. Free WLAN, which is very important for the business traveller. The last night we stayed in One by The Five, a luxury suite. Not only a luxury suite, but also a love suite: designed in a kind of modern baroque style, with two bathrooms, a budoir, a dancefloor (!), not to mention the up- to-date home entertainmet center, a little garden, and a bedroom that really makes you fly. That would be the perfect hideaway for honeymooners and lovers or the ideal ambience for a wedding proposal. Leaving Paris is always sad, but leaving The Five in Paris is even more......

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jdstan
Reviews.Content: Back in may, i decide to have a weekend away with my wonderful girlfriend to treat her, so i booked up online for a amazing looking hotel. Looking on the website The Five Hotel had stunning rooms. When arriving at the hotel we was greeted by a lovely team of girls behind the desk. They were led by a girl called Tanya, who couldn't do enough for us. When telling her it was our first year anniversary, took it on herself to make sure we had an amazing one. Opening the door of the room and walking in, we was greeted by a bucket of ice and a cold bottle of champagne. Which was lovely to drink after a early start to the day and traveling there. The room was stunning, perfect to be honested, it was very romantic, with a really modern feel. I love anything modern and different to the norm. So for me i was over joyed. The breakfast delievered to our room was very good, it was a typically a french breakfast and was very nice. We didn't eat in the hotel again tll the next days breakfast. When leaving we was sad that the weekend was coming to an end but he team at the hotel made it one to remember. Thank you Tanya and her team

Reviews.Title: “J'adore The Five!”
Reviews.Author: NY_LON_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Five for a couple of nights on a business trip in November and would definitely go back. While I definitely had the smallest room in the hotel, it was perfectly formed. The little shower had cute LED lights embedded in the wall and the lighting in the room also had fibre optic embellishments. The staff were very helpful (very above average for a Parisien hotel at this price). I had problems accessing the internet and they were so helpful and polite. When I desperately needed something to eat after hours when room service was over, they brought me hot chocolate and cookies. The location is not the best but it's very easy to get into the Latin Quarter proper or the Marais. On the plus side, the road is very quiet because it's just off the main avenue so it was easy to get a quiet night's sleep. I'd certainly stay again although I would book a larger room, from what I saw they looked great.

Reviews.Title: “stunning hotel !”
Reviews.Author: LondonJuly
Reviews.Content: right in the heart of quartier latin , this is the ideal small luxury hotel to impress your beloved one ! staff is really frieldly and helpfull. room was not so big but the decoration was simply amazing with great use of high quality fabrics and great fashion lightning . nice real nice for a romantic shortbreak in paris !

Reviews.Title: “overstylized, undersubstanced...”
Reviews.Author: deansw1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretending to be something that it's not, with a lot of nonsense about 'stimulating the five senses'... this is all a smokescreen for tiny, expensive rooms and an average location... The hotel is relatively close to Rue Muffletard, which is a great market street, but not near the Latin Quarter (another false boast). Staff are adequate and there are a few nice touches, but overall disappointing... stay somewhere cheaper in a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Agostini666
Reviews.Content: The Five is a nice idea with some issues in implementation. The rooms are tiny and the structure isn't the best. Quiet location, but far from metro main lines.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in suite, good, not great, but super staff.”
Reviews.Author: JLS813
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the phone, and it was extremely easy to do so. We booked the suite since we were bringing our two chihuahuas and needed the space. We too knew to expect a smaller than usual room, but even so were still surprised at the size, even with the suite. The bathroom was a great size and the lights and fixtures were beautiful. It was nice to have a separate little seating area with a great flat screen, also very pretty. The bedroom however was so small I actually woke up in the night feeling a little panicky. I also woke up due to very loud and continual banging from the other side of the wall directly beside my head, both nights. I believe it was from the building beside or perhaps behind the front desk. The hot tub and terrace are cute, but totally not private with about 50 windows looking right down on you. The hot tub has a curtain so we still enjoyed it, though not allowed after 9 pm. The door to the room is right in the lobby, a little awkward but convenient to walk the dogs . The best part was the staff!! The girl at the front was SO helpful, made perfect suggestions for restaurants as though she knew us personally. I must suggest Marty's Oyster Bar, absolutely fantastic food and service, and about a 7 minute walk away. The area is totally un-stereotypical Paris, so if you want eiffel tower views you'll be disappointed. We loved it however with great open markets, pubs and cafes, which is needed since there is no room service or bar in the hotel- but good for getting you out to experience Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: IanDamaged
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great area, the rooms are not large but not many are in Paris but they are clean and very modern with lovely bathrooms as well, we stayed on the second floor, 202, nice and quiet too. Hotel is in a great area, near the bottom of Rue Mouffetard, 5 mins walk, lots of restaurants, bars and great breakfast places, we had breakfast in the hotel one day which was nice too but the weather was so good we ventured out on the second. The people who work here are really good and helpful too and spoke great English too. So all in all a really good location and hotel, I will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Paris”
Reviews.Author: satellite67
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and great location. Convenient to walk to the metro - 5 mins. Walk to the Rue Mouffetard lower end 10 min. After seeing Paris sights on previous trips we enjoyed ourselves chilling out amongts the many cafe's and bistros near by. Friendly, beautiful staff and very helpful. Patisserie and wine stores nearby to stock up for romantic nights in your lovely room. Rooms are small but this is common in Paris - great modern design but also quality fittings. Would recommend to everyone except anyone wanting a old traditional hotel type style. Overall, a lovely 3 day break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars for The Five Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbbrutus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Latin Quarter of Paris, about a 20 minute walk from Notre Dame. It is located away from the tourist sites so gives you more of a "living in Paris" type of feel. There are 3 metro stations nearby which will take you to most of the sites. The hotel itself is very well decorated, with great attention to detail. The staff are very friendly and happy to help with any questions you may have. The rooms are pretty small, but when you are likely to be out exploring for most of the day, that is all you really need. All in all a great hotel, particularly for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choise!!”
Reviews.Author: maiko81
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. We loved the receptionist, Karine. She did her best to have the most amazing christmass holidays. The hotel location was good, the interiors were perfect, the exterior is soooo Paris!! The rooms have the most great bathrooms and the most amazing beds! We do not have words to describe how great time we had. A perfect A+ for the Five!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: marsabez
Reviews.Content: Couple stayed in one of the standard rooms. We booked through their website and got an amazing rate of 110 Euros/night as a part of a three night minimum deal. The rooms were modern, hip, and very well designed. Although they were on the small side, all liitle nooks were used smartly. Service was also great and we reccomend the breakfast in the hotel as a single espresso with a croissant can cost up to five euros on the street. We can't wait to go back to The Five!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hereandthereandback
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the area and we weren't disappointed with either. It is well located with good transport links via the bus and metro into the centre of Paris. The area around the hotel is nice and easy with great little cafes and shops - there is a fantastic chocolate patisserie on the corner run by two Japanese girls that create works of art. The staff in the hotel were very helpful 'googling' any requests for information that they didn't know. We were up graded on arrival and our room was perfect for a short stay with nice touches, such as mood lighting and essential oils burning in the rooms. Would recommend the hotel to friends and family and would return there again for another short break to soak up Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel but Smallish”
Reviews.Author: MacMil
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed three nights at this stylish but very cramped hotel. The rooms are indeed quite cute, but we spent more time marvelling at the resourceful use of the limited space in the bedroom and bathroom. The beds are comfortable and we did sleep very well. Three days is probably as long as I would wish to stay here, as the limited space means you are constantly having to move things. However the overall design is very nice and cheerful. The hotel recommended two restaurants Chez Marty (10 minutes walk away) and Le Bofinger which were excellent for service and food. At Le Bofinger we had the seafood platter for two and it was heavenly. Beware! We asked the hotel to order a taxi to take us to Le Bofinger, and when it arrived we was surprised to see 10 Euros already on the meter. Apparently the meter starts when the taxi firm receives the call from the hotel. I think this is very bad and really the hotel should have warned us about this when we asked them to book the cab. On another night we ate at a local restaurant called Le Petit Marguery but this one failed to live up to expectations. Although the restaurant was not recommended by the hotel, they do display their card. The food was fine but very expensive for what we got. Also the guy who 'waited' on us showed us almost no interest - prefering instead to chat and preen with the locals. He failed to keep our wine glasses topped up the whole night, and eventually when our glasses were empty I had to resort to wrapping my napkin around the bottle in the ice bucket and pour the wine myself. To cap it all he tried to charge us for two bottles of water when we only had one (at 7Euros a bottle + tax a total rip-off!). All in all we would stay again at the hotel and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “5 out of 5, for The Hotel Five”
Reviews.Author: BizDundee
Reviews.Content: This is a funky little Hotel in a quiet area which delivers all the essential requirements for a hassle free trip to Paris. A spotless, fresh Hotel with very comfy bed, excellent shower and full a/c. The breakfast is a leisurely buffet affair which was served by charming, cheerful staff, attributes shared with the Reception staff who were all extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: born2beatraveller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel, room was very small but the space billiantly used. The price was the same as a lot of other hotels on a website, but I chose it because it literally was a diamond amongst the rough. Forget old fashioned, decrepid buildings where the amenities have seen better days, this modern hotel was fab! Myself and a girlfriend stayed here on the weekend for a mini hen do as none of my other friends could go and this hotel made a wonderful base. I would normally stay near the Champ Elysee as it is more central, but my partner and I always end up getting taxis so it really made no difference, expect to pay around 14 Euros for a taxi to the L'arc de Triompe. The staff cannot do enough to help and really made you feel at home, love it and will definately be coming back. Merci tellement The Five Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Offspring_Msk
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Paris on our way to US and were very pleasantly surprised by One by the five (a luxury one-suite hotel managed by The five hotel). It's a fabulous hotel in a great location - not to close to the tourist crowd but close enough to be only a couple of stops on the Metro from anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is beautiful, modern, amazingly designed and very clean. The bed was huge and the bathroom was large with a fantastic shower. Plus, we were greeted with champagne and fruits which was a nice compliment. Staff were very warm and informative and made many enquires and bookings for us that were dealt with very professionally. I would recommend this hotel for a romantic 2-3 night getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pernes
Reviews.Content: I always stay in this hotel when I am working in Paris. It has a wonderfully friendly atmosphere, the staff are warm and extremely helpful. It is very well-situated and close to great bars and restaurants and also good bus and metro links. I would highly recommend staying here for a truely enjoyable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to go back!”
Reviews.Author: agaan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something special to offer for my boyfriend’s birthday. That’s how I’ve found ONE BY THE FIVE hotel. This is a hotel created by THE FIVE HOTEL, where we stayed during our previous stay in Paris.I adored it! An exceptional experience! Even my boyfriend liked the romantic atmosphere of it. And me, I loved the design and of course the floating bed. Rooms are really big there, there’s a lot of space, a terrace and a kitchen. We spent the evening creating cocktails))A bit expensive but absolutely worth it, especially as a birthday present. I will recommend to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Charming stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: korovaarisha
Reviews.Content: The One by The Five is an extremely nice hotel created by The Five Hotel (situated two steps far). This one-room design hotel is unique. It has its own entry, 3 rooms and 2 bathrooms. Everything is decorated in a very modern but romantic way. There is a small kitchen where you can make erotic cocktails (you have everything for it, including fresh fruits and berries), coffee machine etc. And in a cozy boudoir we’ve found several trendy perfumes (like Dior and Chanel) to try. I very much liked this idea. We stayed there for 2 nights and were pleased by friendly stuff and service. It was a pleasure for me to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Flamboyant hotel, near everything”
Reviews.Author: hvitved
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful time in The Five, excellent staff (even on English... sorry to say still a common lack in Paris). Disliked: Small cranny bathroom. Liked: The style of the hotel, the staff, the cleanliness. Small but neat hotel. Close by everything. We'd recommend restaurant Marcel by Les Gobelins for a nice french dinner aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Viva le five and hello to karine !”
Reviews.Author: SergeParis001
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is quite well located, but the decoration is increditble, i you like mode and artistic concept you will ove it. We have a great time with my wife, the staff is very nice, our room was a suite with a jacouzie, I know that some of the other rooms are small, but the place is really nice. You have to see it !

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hiledinburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Five Hotel for the first three nights of our Honeymoon and we were delighted with our choice! The hotel is in a very good location, away from the busy tourist melee of the left bank in a nice, peaceful neighbourhood with several little bars and restaurants nearby. It was the perfect choice. The hotel itself is very nice, as you would expect from a boutique hotel it is small but well designed and modern. Our stay started well due to the friendliness of the staff, Tania & Laure, who made us feel very welcome and also sent up a complementary half bottle of champagne on the first night to celebrate our honeymoon. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to Rue Mouffetard which is a bustling street full of small shops, cafes, bars and restaurants and we were able to find plenty of places to enjoy dinner here. For something a bit more special there is a restaurant very close to the hotel, Au Petit Marguery , it was worth paying a little extra for this delightful meal and the restaurant seemed full of local Parisians which added to the atmosphere. The hotel is well located for walking through the Latin Quarter and up to the Left Bank, Notre Dame etc. We would definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for somewhere to spend a romantic few days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “so petite yet utterly stylish!”
Reviews.Author: cazziebLondon
Reviews.Content: I organised my girlfriends hen weekend here and was nervous the hotel would live up to the websites description. When we arrived we were so warmly welcomed by Karen and she made our stay perfect. She was helpful friendly personal and also glamorous! The hotel itself and the rooms are small but the attention to detail is second to none and the decor was fabulous. An absolute steal for the price and I will definitely return as Karen took great care of us!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here--You'll Love It”
Reviews.Author: DeeperVoice
Reviews.Content: The two most important things I look for in a hotel room are 1) quietness and 2) comfort. We got both at The Five Hotel, plus a whole lot more. The walls are completely soundproofed so we heard nothing from ajoining rooms--perfect! The bed was extremely comfortable, resulting in three nights of uninterrupted sleep. Our room was impeccably clean and the en-suite shower room was fantastic. Each room has a unique look and style. We stayed in 'Superior Glimmering with Baldaquin' Room 101 on the first floor. That's the black and white room with stars above the bed - very romantic! It's small and roomy, if that makes sense, and tastefully designed using the art of Isabel Emmerique. The hotel management have paid particularly close attention to even the smallest detail. The televison in the room is a Loewe digital with about 400 satellite channels--including two from Thailand, so my boyfriend was happy! The staff are very friendly and helpful and were always happy to point us in the right direction of where we wanted to go, including marking our route out on a map for us. On one occasion, during a heavy rain shower, I was offered an umbrella by the guy in reception when I needed to nip out to the shop around the corner. It's these little things that make a huge difference. TIP: There's a door outside each set of rooms. Close it over at night for additional soundproofing from the stairs. (I think perhaps the hotel management should consider keeping these intervening doors closed rather than propped open?) TIP: The Five Hotel is located on a quiet side street (Rue Flatters) that's not shown on most maps. You'll find it between Rue Berthollet and Rue Broca off Boulevard de Port-Royal. TIP: The hotel have a website for people who have stayed at the hotel: www.thefivespace.com It's got a lot of restaurant reviews and suggestions about what to do around the area. We only discovered this site after we checked out. TIP: There's a plethora of Asian restaurants within walking distance on Avenue de Choisy, however for genuine Thai food, you should visit Chieng Mai Thai restaurant, 12 Rue Frederice Sautin (Maubert-Mutualite Metro station). We booked our room directly through the hotel's website www.thefivehotel.com because they offer a discount (at the time of writing) if you stay three nights or more. I recommend this designer hotel for being arty, funky and the top-rated gay-friendly hotel in the Latin Quarter. Well done Five Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: caryso
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a room at the Five Hotel for our anniversary, without telling me. What a nice surprise! When we arrived we had a bottle of champagne offered by the hotel, and petals displayed on our bed! The staff paid attention to every detail during our stay to make it perfect. We decided to take the breakfast in our room, and we had a beautiful tray with refined pastries and delicious coffee. The rooms are not very large, but so well equipped and so design that you forget their size. The hotel has very original details like optical fiber and perfume lamps that make it unique.The Five Hotel is pretty well located, close to the vibrant Rue Mouffetard where we had a very nice French dinner. I recommend this small and charming boutique hotel to all the lovers!

Reviews.Title: “Magic !!”
Reviews.Author: possye
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I spent a magic night at the Five Hotel! The design and atmosphere are totally dedicated to love and romance. We had booked a room through their website, with a ceiling full of stars: it was like sleeping under the stars but in a hotel room! The rooms are very functional and well-equipped. We enjoyed a lot the breakfast, with its large choice of delicious French products!The receptionists we met at the Five Hotel were very nice and helpful, and we could even borrow a laptop for free. The most surprising was the choice of the perfume of the room that added – in my opinion – a refined touch to this lovely hotel.We can’t wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: poisons
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, small, modern, small, clean, small. If it's small? YES. The bathroom is so little that you need to be a gymnast to wash your theet. The room 603 despite its deluxe naming, has only a deluxe design. For 300 € per night I would have expected much more. The staff is very kind and comprehensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 1TravelerFromLA
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at The Five Hotel for my second time. It is definitely my favorite hotel to stay at because of the decor, the staff, and the ambiance. The rooms are decorating very well, and are quite nice for a Parisian hotel. I love the fiber optic lights in the rooms, on the ceiling and even in the shower. I stayed in their new suite, which is fantastic. There is a great breakfast you can have downstairs or in your room. There is also free wireless internet in your room, which is a bonus. I love this hotel and will always return to stay there when I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FifaChardonne
Reviews.Content: We spent some wonderful days in the Five Hotel, which is ideally placed in Paris. We had the suite for 4 persons. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the private jacuzzi on the terrace was the event for the kids. The rooms are not very big, but you really don't need much more just for sleeping. Very nice bathroom! Very helpful and friendly people at reception. We skipped the breakfast, as it was a little bit expensive (15Euro per person). Will certainly come back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, chic, friendly - strong choice for the imaginative”
Reviews.Author: jcbluk
Reviews.Content: We, a 24 year old professional couple from the UK, stayed at Five Hotel for three nights in March 2008, in a standard room. Location: 5-10 minutes from Les Gobelins metro - Gare du Nord is realistically a 30 minute transfer by Metro. Other reviewers have commented that this is the 'edge' of the Latin Quarter: it is, but the bottom of the Rue Mouffetard is five minutes away, with a strong range of eating options. The more adventurous can try the student area of Butte aux Cailles, 25 minutes walk into the 13th. The area immediately around the hotel is safe, quiet if a little dull - however contains one exceptional bistrot on Rue Broca - 'L'Ourcine' offers top-drawer French cuisine in an unpretentious setting and for little more than the pricer tourist fare. Estimated walking times: Louvre 45 minutes; Orsay 50 minutes. Metro times: Louvre, 15 minutes; Orsay 20 minutes; Eiffel Tower & Montmartre 30 minutes Room: Small, very stylish, well appointed. Five's rooms are individually and boldly decorated, with 'signature' art work in each room. The bed was well above average for the class of hotel, although very much a standard double in size terms. Clever fiberoptic lighting created a restful atmosphere at night. Bathroom again small, but powerful shower, L'Occitane toiletries. Best choice of TV channels I've ever seen in a continental room. Room was very quiet to sleep in, with the shutter blocking all external light if desired. Only downside was that the room was difficult to cool down overnight. Food: Didn't have breakfast. Would say it looks a little overpriced at 15e, couple of nice patisseries nearby which will do the same a lot cheaper. Note there was no fridge in our room, although reasonably priced drinks are available 24 hours from reception. Staff: Very friendly, very mutlilingual, unobtrusive and competent. Room was immaculately made up at all times. Overall: Some travellers like enormous, blandly decorated hotel rooms, locations on top of a transport link and/or right in the middle of the action. You can get this in Paris, and pay through the nose - but not here. For the confident traveller needing a stylish and comfortable left bank base, Five Hotel offers excellent value and a friendly welcome with a hint of fun. A significant cut above the average Parisien 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel in the 5th Arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: Nuadha
Reviews.Content: Just back from a pleasent stay in the Five Hotel. The rooms are unique, with each having it's own "style". The rooms seemed very clean on the surface, but when I lifted up the sheet accidentally, the undersheet wasn't quite as clean as the rest of the room and the ensuite bathroom. The breakfast seemed rather steeply priced at €15 per person per day, so we skipped on that and went down the street for breakfast. The room was not large, but definitely not small by Paris standards, and did not feel in any way cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Very specal wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manatee31
Reviews.Content: The Five Hotel is a little gem in the middle of Paris. I have stayed there for three nights and had a wonderful experience. Although the rooms are pretty small, the warm welcome you get from all of the staff and the sensual feeling you receive throughout the whole hotel makes this place very special.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Design”
Reviews.Author: Oublio
Reviews.Content: The five hotel definitely deserves a special "five star" score for the service and the friendlyness of the personel! Our stay was brief but perfect... Though the rooms are small, they are trendy, comfortable, everything you need is there and the scent in the rooms is great! If we ever visit Paris again, Five hotel is where we'll be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by the coherent esthetics of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serial_Dealer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in The Five Hotel for 1 night, on 7th Feb 2008 and I can say that the most probably I will attempt to stay there the next time I will return to Paris (if there will be available room). What did I like in The Five Hotel? a) Position: just 5 minutes walk from RER station Port Royal (and RER connects directly, in minutes, to Orly and Charles De Gaule airports). Just 15 minutes walk from Notredamme...great for turists and for business traveller as well. b) Friendly and helpful staff. c) Design: marvelously coherent esthetics, full of original details (see the attached photos) compensating fully the limited dimensions of the room. d) Flat screen TV with over 100 channels. e) Free broadband Internet. f) Functional furniture. The only remark concerns the breakfast: limited choice of food and beverage for the price of € 15,00. Apart the breakfast, I could reccomend the hotel to the business traveller and young couples able to appreciate the design of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and design in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PaulaAbreu
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised by the decoration, the comfort and service of the Five Hotel. We feel that is was an unique experience, every detail is a good idea. The bedroom was wonderful; all the ornaments are special picked. The bed was very comfortable! Even the bathroom was very cute, it has a special light to read on toilet, and even the toilet things is wonderful, everything is super clean. The breakfast was very good, very particular what you can choose to eat, it has a nice coloured space were you relax for a journey on Paris. The Five is localized near the famous/historic Quartier Latin, an obligatory place to go when you visit Paris. The next time we go to Paris, we must stay there; it increases the glamour of the city.

Reviews.Title: “The 5 is a Real Jewel”
Reviews.Author: artstew55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for something different for our one night stay in Paris, and the 5 was all of that and more. As boutique hotels go, this is one of the best I've stayed in for that important blend of esthetic flair and creature comfort. The interior of the hotel itself is a blast of beautifully blended vibrant colors. Our room was small but perfectly outfitted, and the "hanging" bed was exactly what we needed for a deep night sleep after a long flight from Australia. The staff were all efficient and extremely helpful when we needed information about restaurants in the neighborhood. I liked the location of the hotel - it's in a quiet corner near Les Gobelins and within walking distance of Montparnasse for great shopping. I thought the breakfast adequate, without frills, but was mesmerized by the incredible design of the dining area; it's a small room but has the feel of a bigger eating hall. If you're looking for a unique place to stay in Paris for a few romantic nights with your partner, I highly recommend the 5.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: yoomee
Reviews.Content: This rates as one of the most relaxing breaks my wife and i have ever had. From the moment we arrived to the departure we totally enjoyed the expeariance the Hotel offers. Breakfast in bed was the icing on the cake. If you are looking for ideal location and relaxation for a Paris break the Five Hotel is a must.

Reviews.Title: “The Five hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackbear11
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is extremely helpful and friendly, some of the nicest we have encountered. The breakfast was a little lacking, especially for the price of 15 Euros. There was an unpleasant odor in the lobby and near the elevators (sewage problems?), but the rooms themselves were nice in general. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LDN333
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Five Hotel for a three night break in Paris and had a great experience. It's modern, trendy & spotless and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The staff: there's a 24 hour reception service, and everyone we saw on the front desk was unfailingly friendly and polite. They wree always making sure that we were having a good stay, and asking whether there was anything we needed or that they could do for us. They even found us glasses to go with the champagne we'd brought for my fiance's birthday (which they also chilled for us!) Couldn't fault them - they were lovely. The rooms - modern, clean, quiet (Rue Flatters is a side street so no traffic). There's no denying that the rooms are small (although fairly average for Parisian hotels), but the beds are huge and there's lots of tucked-away storage. We were in the 'blue room' and particularly loved the sparkly lights set into the ceiling and along the edge of the shelving. The location - it's close to Gobelins metro station, and to Port Royal RER (which is on a line running direct to Gare du Nord.) We came home late every night and felt safe walking back either from the Metro or from the St Michel/St Germain area. It's close to the lively university area around the Sorbonne, and there are lots of cafes in the immediate Gobelins/Port Royal area too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely ...a place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Frita
Reviews.Content: A genuine warm welcome accompanied the door opening. Fast, friendy and efficient check-in. This boutique hotel is certainly a place I will recommend for those who intend to spend a couple of nights in Paris. The rooms (the one we got, Delux Superior) was relatively small. The room features, the amenities and service overcome the above point. If you have time, experience the breakfast. I felt...at home!

Reviews.Title: “A Magical stay in Paris .....”
Reviews.Author: FrancisChantilly
Reviews.Content: I am travelling a lot across Europe and I have to say that this location is really a very good surprise in Paris: the welcome is great, the design is very nice, the place very quiet, easy to find and well placed in center ..... I will definitively come back !!! I was with my wife and we got a so romantic room with a roof full of little lights such as stars in the Night ..... The hotel is close to a nice student corner: rue Mouffetard where you can go easily by walking and find shops, bars, pubs, restaurants and so on ..... Last but not least: in comparison to many other hotels in Paris Center the price is very good for the service, the welcome and the design you find there . I recommand you a stay here if you look for a romantic week end or stay to visit Paris

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, if a bit small”
Reviews.Author: KateW_Herts
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in Jan 2008. Excellent customer service - very friendly. Hotel was exceptionally clean - particularly the bathroom. Room 103 - room was very small - with two of us in the room it was a struggle - it would be fine if you were staying on your own. Any longer than two nights would have been a bit much I think. Lovely comfortable bed. L'Occtaine goody bag. Good location - just over 5 mins to Pantheon, and just over 5mins to Metro as well. Didn't have the breakfast (which was 15 euros each), as there were a couple of lovely local patissieries and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “City Chic”
Reviews.Author: sjp27
Reviews.Content: The Five Hotel was great! The hotel was clean and comfortable and the service was impeccable. All the receptionists were so helpful and attentive. The hotel even offered free champagne and crackers to all the guests on New Year's Eve. My only complaint was that the room was really small (we stayed in the suite...I can't imagine what the smaller rooms were like!), but I had read the reviews beforehand so I expected it. Other than that, location was good and the bakery next door was so yummy! Overall, the Five is a really cool, chic boutique known for it's unique design elements. Space is a really small price to pay for the value you get when you stay at the Five.

Reviews.Title: “Designer luxury”
Reviews.Author: TravelcrazyAntwerp
Reviews.Content: The Five hotel is an excellent, trendy and clean hotel, with a very helpfull and friendly staff. My husband and I stayed there for one night on december 20th 2007 and were enchanted by it. True, the room we stayed in was not very big, but the clever design and the use of the colours made it very cosy. The breakfastroom downstairs follows the red-white-and black colour scheme of the rest of the hotel and the breakfast is a buffet. The hotel is situated in the Quartier Latin in Paris, which is in walking distance to The Notre Dame, or if you don't like walking, the metrostation Les Gobelins is very close by. We had a very quiet and romantic night there. So, if you like to treat yourself to some designer luxury, the Five hotel is definitively the place to be ! Katrin, Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Traveller85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent--the hotel is as seen on the web if not better. Very nice, helpful staff and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tres funky, but small”
Reviews.Author: asinnorway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Five Hotel end of Nov and thoroughly enjoyed the experience as that is the best way to describe it. You could look at the negatives, ie v. small rooms, not enough tables in the breakfast room but I think there are more positives to this hotel. Loved the decor in the rooms and thought they made very good use of very limited space. Probably wouldn't want to stay more than a couple of nights but for a weekend away w/o kids this was well located and suited perfectly. Staff very helpful throughout and assisted in making dinner reservations at a nearby restaurant that turned out to be very good. I would recommend but would make people aware that it is a small hotel in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: krisdeco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Paris and have just stayed the last night at the Five hotel . We are still on cloud nine! It was a real change of scene. The rooms are not too big and the king size beds so comfortable that you think you are in a luxurious cocoon with the technology of fiber optic, even in the bathroom! Every room has its own design and we chose the twinkling superior one with its suspended bed. Very important: the hearty welcome of the staff. I recommend this hotel to all romantic people. A little advice: bring your laptop with your best playlist so as to the music complete the dream… Kris.

Reviews.Title: “Just like I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie24
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Five hotel on November 1st and I had an excellent stay. The room was very charming, I knew it was not going to be big but as a single traveller the size didn't bother me at all. I loved the special decoration in the room and bathroom, the special bath products, the great bed and the flat screen tv on the wall! The staff was also extremely friendly and the breakfast was great as well. The only negative thing is that my room was not ready before 4 PM, I thought that was a bit late...but overall I really enjoyed my stay in The Five. I would say the metro is at 5 min, RER at about 10 min and the neighbourhood is very nice. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KizzieLondon
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be excellent, most helpful, they went out of the way to assist us with travel and work obligations and were friendly and very nice to speak to. The hotel was funky, sparkling, clean, tidy and had a good atmosphere, the rooms were spotless, presentable and the beds were very, very comfortable. The location is great - a short walk to some of the best restaurants I have ever eaten in (which came highly recommended by the staff), a short taxi ride from the Eurostar train station and the area is very clean and had friendly people in the nearby pubs and shops. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice idea poorly executed”
Reviews.Author: dmw00
Reviews.Content: We booked two superior glimmering double rooms to stay at the hotel five on the 5th November as we where in Paris to celebrate a friends 30th birthday. We did a fair bit of trawling around the internet and decided that this hotel sounded interesting, funky and something a little different. The hotel is tucked away in the Latin quarter of the city which is great for boutique shops and some good night life. It's still a treck into town though with pont neuf a good 40 minutes on foot. There is no subway particually close either so it's taxi or brave the interesting bus system paris has. We arrived early for check in and where greeted by friendly staff who kindly let us check in then. The first thing that strikes you is the reception/lounge, pokey but nicely decked out. This was a theme that was to continue... We where directed to our rooms, both on level one, 102 and 104, I was amazed when i opened the door to the room, unfortunatly it was not for the style or decor we where so looking forward to but the shoe box we where going to be staying in. Put it this way it was uncomfortable for two people to stand or try and do anything in the room at the same time, and i'm not particually the biggest fan of pies if you know what I mean. I immediatley thought that we must have been allocated the wrong room type as we had not gone for standard but had opted for superior, surely you should be able to swing a cat in a superior room? I asked the girl at reception what room types 102 and 104 where. Superior Glimmering was the reply. Shocked I returned to my room wondering how small a standard was! Dissapointingly also not mentioned on the website is the lack of a bar, so meeting point was reception. Despite the size issue there are a few funky light fittings and a lamp that smells, fabric on the walls. I could see the idea but just didnt have enough room to walk around the bed to check everything out. It would seem from some of the other good reviews that there are some good rooms but they are not 102 or 104. My advise to the hotel here would be to knock through the walls of 101 into 102 and 103 into 104 and make some decent sized rooms. I wouldn't go back and couldn't reccomend it personally, but if you are going to stay I would make sure you have a minimum of a luxurious room type, but then if you are going to spend E300 you may as well stay in L'Hotel and be blown away with 5* luxury! Sorry Hotel Five nice idea but poorly executed. I would have given you this feedback on check out if anyone had asked how I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Did I just have a bad room?”
Reviews.Author: jenniferlcordes
Reviews.Content: I must have just had a bad room or something because I hated this hotel. I was on the first floor and in a room the size of a shoebox. I would never stay here again because of it. My husband and I were stumbling over ourselves to both fit in the room and neither of us could barely turn around in the shower. I know the rooms are small in Paris because I have stayed in many. This was HORRIBLY small. On the upside, Karine at the reception was delightful and tremendously helpful. All in all, I would only recommend this to younger travelers perhaps in their 20"s. WE are too old perhaps to stay in what felt like a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at design hotel”
Reviews.Author: teip
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights at the Five hotel. Rooms are quiet small (around 10 square meter), especially the bathroom was tiny, but I thought it was charming. Excellent shower & bed, flatscreen tv with over 300 channels (including dutch/ flemish BVN - channel 54). Very friendly staff. Breakfast was only served from 7.30, so I cannot comment on that. The hotel is located in a side street of the Blvd. du Pont Royal, a quiet and - as far as I could tell - safe neighbourhood at night. Travellers arriving in Paris at the Gare du Nord should take the RER (Line B), and get off at the Pont Royal station. Follow the Boulevard du Pont Royal for a couple of minutes, and you're there!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Coming from San Francisco recently, and a frequent visitor to NYC and Miami, I've seen my share of wonderfully done chic boutique hotels and the wonderful touches of inspired creative luxury. The Five is not the Delano, the Clift, or the SoHo Grand... but if you appreciate the style of these, the Five may be a welcome treat. It's small, yes, true. "Hidden", I might argue, due to it's non-descript exterior on a small side-street a few minutes away from the center of the action. But as soon as you step inside the diminutive lobby, the warm welcome, cool furnishings and enthusiastic staff will confirm you've made a smart choice. Among it's points of interest: - sliding "wall" turned out to be my window covering (great for sleeping in) - shower wall covered in tiny lights - scented lamps - free WiFi - artsy metal-covered doors with LED room numbers illuminated above each - Hotel 5 blog: guests invited to join this online community, complete with your photo Service was very friendly and personal. Upon checkin, among conversation and laughs, staff member offered me one of her chocolate truffels from chocolatiere next door. Upon checkout, while waiting for delayed taxi, was offered free espresso. Very nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtvler
Reviews.Content: I looked around the internet forever to find a nice hotel in Paris for a somewhat reasonable price. The Five Hotel was great, it is super stylish and our room was nice and quiet. The only downside of this hotel for me was that you have to walk just under ten minutes to the metro station. But if you go to the east there are some other areas that not many tourists venture into that are great to discover. The other issue that some people may have is that the shower is tiny in comparison to North American standards, but they do have LED lights in the shower tiles that look cool.

Reviews.Title: “Five Hotel a little gem”
Reviews.Author: typslo
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at "The Five" was a delight. My wife and I were on our 25th anniversary of marriage trip and were looking for something modern and hip, we found both at The Five. Karine and her staff were most welcoming, Tonya at the desk upgraded our room which was small but with a little planning had room for our American sized luggage. We do not travel light, and actually had space to unpack. All of the fixtures were first rate, tiny bath but with a great shower and towels, aromatherapy, fiber optic canopy, real air conditioning, nice soaps etc... With the metro on Gobelins a 10 minute walk we found "getting around town" easy. It was a pleasure not to be in the heart of the tourist scene. The AOKI patisserie on Port Royal though pricey, had the most decadent croissant au' chocolate you ever put to your lips. We skipped the hotel breakfast, I walked to Starbucks for coffee. All said maybe a St. Germain location would be closer but not up to the coolness factor of The Five. David and Diane, Waynesville NC,USA

Reviews.Title: “Five out of five for Five”
Reviews.Author: Francoholic
Reviews.Content: Our one-night stay was a very positive experience, starting with a charming and friendly welcome at reception. Loved the quirky and fresh decor (good to see so much colour in a world of brown and beige hotels), and the attention to detail in our room. The hotel's discreet exterior, blending inconspicuously with the adjacent buildings, is admirable in its restraint. Breakfast, in the bright and cheerful basement, brought a cafetiere of strong coffee with excellent croissants and bread. A quiet location from which to explore the Latin Quarter, exceptionally friendly reception, and strong coffee...the only scope for improvement is a larger room which we would certainly go for the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fun, fun at the Five”
Reviews.Author: artforartssake
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Five. The staff were very helpful and friendly and went to great lengths to sort out a problem for a friend who had also booked in there. The decor and ambience were just right: different, quirky, fun. The bed was compfortable, bathroom was excellent, all great. But, don't expect a lot of space - the room was small; be happy about this before you book - you don't want to spoil a great experience. The area was quiet and very pleasant. The Metro was five minutes walk away and it was ten minutes on that to the Seine, Notre Dame etc. Or, a twenty minute walk, if you prefer. I'd book there again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Liked The Five Hotel A Lot”
Reviews.Author: sherful2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a single traveler on vacation for a week and enjoyed it. If you are looking to have basic necessities, cool accessories, and a bilingual staff, you will want to consider this place. As other reviews noted, the rooms are small (I'm not sure what the suites are like) but a standard room has a tiny bathroom thats just enough for one person to stand in, but the room was totally new, clean, and had L'Occitane complimentary lotions. The design in the room is cool and has neon lights in the desk. The futuristic look really attracted me. The location is pretty good also. It's about a 15 minute walk from the Port Royal RER B train station and a 20 minute walk from the Jardin du Luxembourg. I would recommend this for single travelers and if you are with another person(s) you may want to pay more for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Wannabe Trendy - still work to do to pretend this”
Reviews.Author: BangkokAdmirers
Reviews.Content: I have been to many many hotels in Paris and I was looking for something better. I am french, and my family lives in Paris, therefore I am used to Parisian Hotels. Location: Not so well-located in a boring street of Paris, the hotel looks trendy but in fact is a bit cheap (furniture, reception - not even a seat to complete their client form). Welcome: When we arrived (at +/- 13h00) the receptionnist informed us that the room would not be ready before 16h00... Then she pretended that this was written in all their confirmations. When I presented the said confirmation to her and she noticed that nothing was written regarding the check in hour, she said "ce n'est pas bien grave" (it's not that a big deal), which I found a bit rude (I am the one who decide when it is a big deal or not, I am paying the room, let me decide if I find it ok or not..). She pretended that they had to check a lot of things in the room and that it took time. Then I have heard her telling someone that you could choose the scent in your room (they use Dyptique scents-famous french candles and scents). She never proposed it to us but the scent was nice so I did not say anything. The room: it is cosy and comfortable, although it is really really small. The bathroom is almost inexistent and just next to the bed, therefore when one goes to the bathroom, it's like you in here with him / her. It's very very clean though, they offer L'Occitane samples in the bathroom which is nice. I was a bit shocked by a note on the table mentioning that you would be charged € 100 if something in the room was stolen or damaged... Not really smart to indicate it that way. I mean, it is logical that if you burn the carpet or if you steal something, you will be charge... General: The elevator is really noisy, and when someone in another room takes a shower, it's like it's raining outside. Apart from that the room is quiet at night and the bed is really comfy. But for some reason the alarm clock (by phone) rang at 7h30... I was a bit surprised that after the so called check of the room, they forgot that... The wi-fi does not work properly but when we complained about it the receptionnist (a guy) proposed us to use the hotel computer if needed, which I found really nice of him. Breakfast: it's a rip-off! €15 per person for an average breakfast. Everywhere in the hotel they pretend that the breakfast is marvellous and wonderful and delicious etc. They show off with Mariage Frères teas, but you can't even choose your tea (I had my tea served without any question; by chance it was my favourite-Earl Grey French Blue) although there are at least 10 different boxes of tea presented. The viennoiseries are really average and so are the jellys and other stuffs. The breakfast room is dark, small, and as cheap as the rest of the hotel. And during breakfast we''ve heard the receptionnist (the same as when we arrived) talking to the (charming) waitress, asking her very loud to clean the "[--]" (merde) at the reception... So classy... My general opinion is that to pretend to be a so-called trendy place, you really have to work on the quality and the welcome. However for Paris the price (€220 for the cheapest room) + quality is ok. The other receptionnist (a charming asian girl) advised me to call instead of using internet booking, because they often offer prices. PS: I will download my pictures later. I have to admit it was a bit difficult in such a small room to take good pictures...

Reviews.Title: “Cool, stylish design, friendly staff and near spot-on location”
Reviews.Author: Herit
Reviews.Content: The Five hotel is small! You can see when entering that the lobby is little more than 4 by 5 metres, and when you ascend the bold coloured stairs to your room, you will soon enough find out that there aren't more than four rooms to a floor, all of them quite small. But who's complaining? The rooms are cool design pieces, most of them slightly different. There is a small plexiglass desk, plexiglass writing chair, a decent sized bed and cupboards and closets to last you the better part of a week. The bathrooms have internally lighted shower stalls, designer porcelain and are as clean as you would hope for. Again, the colours are bold, and the space is tiny, but everything is more than sufficient unless you are hosting. And why would you want to do that? Less than five minutes (really!) you have Rue Mouffetard, one of the most charming old streets of Paris, where you can absorb the ambience of what to us looked as authentic Parisian life, away from the Eiffel crowd. As there is only one suite, the hotel might not be suitable for other than couples.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: P2PLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful although much smaller than we expected. Location - perfect, the staff is amazing, very friendly and extremely helpful. We couldn't choose a better place to spend our engagement weekend. We will definitely come back and would recommend this charming place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “For the prices its great!”
Reviews.Author: spicechilli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this trendy hotel in the Latin quartier with my mother (aged 65) while the rooms were small we loved it. Staff were helpful, lots of great restaurants in the rue Mouffetard? and a good night's sleep due to the quiet street. Its a little away from all the action, but close Montparnasse (10 via bus) all the wonderful lighting, artwork in the room kept us busy admire something different. Breakfast was a delight. While I wouldn't recommend a long stay here for 1-2 nights, it was fun, clean, and 'comfotable'....

HotelInfo.Name: The Five Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 3, rue Flatters, 75005 Paris, France
